Governing scope

This Law provides for drug prevention and control; management of illegal drug users; drug addiction treatment; responsibilities of individuals, families and agencies organizations in drug prevention and control; state management and international cooperation in drug prevention and control.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@2:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows;

1. Narcotic substances are addictive substances, psychotropic substances are specified in the list of narcotic substances. Drugs issued by the Government.

2. A narcotic substance is a stimulant or psychoactive substance that easily causes addiction to the user.

3. A psychotropic substance is a stimulant or inhibitory substance. psychoactive or hallucinogenic, if used repeatedly can lead to addiction for users.

4. Precursor is an indispensable chemical in the process of preparation and production of narcotics. Drugs are specified in the list of precursors promulgated by the Government.

5. Veterinary drugs contain narcotic substances, precursors are veterinary drugs containing substances specified in Clauses 2, 3 and 4. of this Article.

6. Drug-containing plants are opium poppies, coca plants, cannabis plants and other plants containing narcotics regulated by the Government.

7. Prevention and control drug is the prevention, prevention and fight against crime and drug evils; control of lawful activities related to drugs.

8. Drug crime is the illegal use of drugs, drug addiction and other violations of the drug law that have not reached the point of or are not prosecuted for criminal liability.

9. Control of lawful drug-related activities means permitting, monitoring, inspecting and supervising lawful drug-related activities and preventing and stopping the abuse of such activities for other purposes. other destination.

10. Illegal drug user is a person who uses narcotics without the permission of a competent person or professional agency and has a positive drug test in the body.

11. Drug testing in the body is the practice of specialized techniques to identify drugs in the body through urine samples, blood samples or other samples of the human body.

12. A drug addict is a person who uses drugs, narcotics, and psychotropic drugs and is dependent on these substances.

13. Drug detoxification is the process of performing medical, psychological and social support activities to help drug addicts stop using narcotics, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, and restore physical and mental health. mental health, awareness raising, behavior change to end the illicit use of these substances.

14. Drug detoxification establishment means an establishment established to fully implement the detoxification process in accordance with this Law, including public drug detoxification establishments and voluntary drug detoxification establishments.

Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Environment includes natural and man-made material elements closely related to each other, surrounding people, affecting life, economy, society, existence and development of humans, organisms and nature.

2. Environmental protection activities are activities. prevent and limit adverse impacts on the environment; respond to environmental incidents; overcome environmental pollution and degradation, improve environmental quality; rationally use natural resources, biodiversity and respond to climate change.

3. Environmental components are physical elements that form the environment, including soil, water, air, organisms, sound, light and other forms of matter. 

4. National environmental protection planning is the arrangement, orientation of spatial distribution, zoning, environmental quality management, nature and biodiversity conservation, waste management, and monitoring. and environmental warnings on the defined territory to protect the environment, serving the country's sustainable development goals for the specified period.

5. Strategic environmental assessment is the process of identifying and forecasting trends of major environmental issues, serving as a basis for integrating and integrating environmental protection solutions in policies, strategies and planning. n
6. Preliminary environmental impact assessment is the consideration and identification of the main environmental issues of an investment project during the pre-feasibility study or the stage of proposing the implementation of an investment project.

7 . Environmental impact assessment is the process of analyzing, evaluating, identifying and forecasting the environmental impact of an investment project and taking measures to minimize adverse impacts on the environment.

8. Environmental license is a document issued by a competent state management agency to an organization or individual engaged in production, business or service activities that is allowed to discharge waste into the environment, manage waste, import and export waste. Importing scrap from abroad as raw production materials together with requirements and conditions on environmental protection as prescribed by law.

9. Environmental registration means that the owner of an investment project, production, business or service establishment registers with the state management agency the contents related to waste discharge and environmental protection measures of the enterprise. investment projects, production, business and service establishments (hereinafter collectively referred to as investment projects and establishments).

10. Environmental technical regulation is a mandatory regulation to apply the limit of parameters on environmental quality, the content of pollutants in raw materials, fuels, materials, equipment, products and goods. , waste, technical and management requirements promulgated by competent state agencies in accordance with the law on standards and technical regulations.

11. Environmental standards are regulations that voluntarily apply limits of parameters on environmental quality, content of pollutants in waste, technical and management requirements approved by competent state agencies. or organize the publication in accordance with the law on standards and technical regulations.

12. Environmental pollution is a change in physical, chemical or biological properties of an environmental component that is not in accordance with environmental technical regulations or environmental standards, causing adverse effects on human health, living organisms. and natural.

13. Environmental degradation is the decline in quality and quantity of environmental components, causing adverse effects on human health, organisms and nature.

14. An environmental incident is an incident that occurs during human activities or due to abnormal changes in nature, causing serious environmental pollution or degradation.

15. Pollutants are chemical substances or physical and biological agents that, when present in the environment in excess of the permissible limits, will cause environmental pollution.

16. Persistent pollutant is a highly toxic, persistent pollutant, capable of bioaccumulating and spreading in the environment, adversely affecting the environment and human health.

17. Persistent organic pollutant is a persistent pollutant specified in the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants (hereinafter referred to as the Stockholm Convention).

18. Waste is matter in solid, liquid, gaseous or other forms discharged from production, business, service, daily life or other activities.

19. Solid waste is waste in solid form or sludge.

20. Hazardous waste is waste containing elements that are toxic, radioactive, infectious, flammable, explosive, corrosive, toxic or have other hazardous properties.

21. Waste co-treatment is the incorporation of an existing production process for recycling, treatment, or energy recovery from waste, in which waste is used as a raw material, material, alternative fuel or processed.

22. Pollution control is the process of preventing, detecting, preventing and treating pollution.

23. The load capacity of the environment is the limit of the environment to withstand the impact factors so that the environment can self-heal.

24. Technical infrastructure for environmental protection includes systems of collection, storage, transportation, waste treatment, environmental monitoring and other environmental protection works.

25. Environmental monitoring is the continuous, periodic, irregular and systematic monitoring of environmental composition, factors affecting the environment, and waste in order to provide information on the assessment of the current state of the environment. environmental quality variables and adverse impacts on the environment.

26. Trial operation of a waste treatment facility is an operation aimed at inspecting and evaluating the effectiveness and compliance with environmental protection requirements of the waste treatment facility of the investor, facility, or facility. headquarters, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters.

27. Scrap is a material that is recovered, classified and selected from materials and products discarded in the course of production, business, service or consumption activities to use as raw materials for a production process. other output.

28. Residential community means a community of people living in the same hamlet, hamlet, hamlet, village, hamlet, bon, phum, squirrel, residential group or similar residential area in the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. Male.

29. A greenhouse gas is a gas in the atmosphere that causes the greenhouse effect.

30. The greenhouse effect is a phenomenon in which the sun's radiant energy is absorbed in the atmosphere, converted into heat, causing global warming.

31. Mitigation of greenhouse gas emissions is an activity to reduce the level or intensity of greenhouse gas emissions, increase the absorption of greenhouse gases.

32. Responding to climate change is a human activity aimed at adapting to climate change and mitigating greenhouse gas emissions.

33. Greenhouse gas emission quota is the amount of greenhouse gas that a country, organization or individual is allowed to emit in a specified period of time, calculated in tons of carbon dioxide (CO2) or tons of carbon dioxide (CO2). ) equivalent.

34. The ozone layer is a layer in the Earth's stratosphere that protects the Earth from harmful ultraviolet radiation from the Sun.

35. A carbon credit is a certificate that is commercially tradable and represents the right to emit one ton of carbon dioxide (CO2) or one ton of carbon dioxide (CO2) equivalent.

36. The best available technology is the best technical solution selected to ensure it is suitable with reality, effective in pollution prevention and control, and minimizes adverse impacts on the environment.

37. The concentrated production, business and service zones include industrial parks, export processing zones, high-tech zones and industrial production functional zones of the economic zone.

38. Investment project owner is the investor or investor of the project in accordance with the law on investment, public investment, investment in the form of public-private partnership, and construction.

2. Environmental protection is a central and prerequisite condition, foundation and factor for sustainable socio-economic development. resources and are considered and evaluated during the implementation of development activities.

Governing scope

This law regulates public employees; public employees' rights and obligations; recruitment, employment and management of public employees in public non-business units.
Luật Viên chức@2:
Official

Officials are Vietnamese citizens who are recruited by job position, work at public non-business units under the working contract regime, and receive salary from the salary fund of the unit. public service providers as prescribed by law.
Luật Viên chức@3:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. A managerial officer is a person appointed to hold a managerial position for a definite term, subject to responsible for operating, organizing the performance of one or several jobs in a public non-business unit but not being a civil servant and receiving allowances for managerial positions.

2. Professional ethics are standards standards of awareness and behavior suitable to the particularity of each professional field of activity as prescribed by competent agencies and organizations.

3. Code of conduct are standards of behavior of public employees in the performance of duties and in social relations promulgated by competent state agencies, suitable to the particularities of work in each field of activity and made public for the people to supervise the observance.
 
4. Recruitment is the selection of qualified, qualified and capable people to work as public employees in public non-business units.

5. A working contract is a written agreement between an official and an official. or the person recruited as an official with the head of the public non-business unit in terms of employment position, salary, remuneration regime, working conditions, rights and obligations of each party.

Luật Cư trú@1:
Governing scope

This Law provides for the exercise of the right to freedom of residence of Vietnamese citizens in the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; the registration and management of residence residence; rights, obligations and responsibilities of citizens, agencies and organizations regarding residence registration and management.
Luật Cư trú@2:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. A legal place of residence is a place used to live, owned, or entitled to. use by citizens, including houses, ships, boats, other movable vehicles or other accommodation as prescribed by law.

2. Residency is the practice of citizens living in a locality. points belonging to commune-level administrative units or district-level administrative units where there are no commune-level administrative units (hereinafter collectively referred to as commune-level administrative units).

3. Database of residents Residence is a specialized database that collects information about citizens' residences, is digitized, stored and managed by information infrastructure, connected and shared with the National Database on population and other databases as prescribed by law.

4. Residence registration agency is the residence management agency that directly performs the residence registration of citizens, including the Public Administration. communes, wards and townships; police offices of districts, urban districts, towns, provincial cities, cities under central authority where there is no commune-level administrative unit.

5. Residence registration is the implementation of procedures for permanent residence registration, temporary residence registration, temporary absence declaration, residence notice and information declaration and adjustment of residence information.

6. Residency is a citizen's stay in a place other than his/her permanent residence or temporary residence for less than 30 days.

7. Temporary absence is a citizen's absence from his/her residence for a certain period of time.

8. Permanent place of residence is a place where citizens live stably and permanently and have been registered for permanent residence.

9. A temporary place of residence is a place where a citizen lives for a certain period of time other than his/her permanent residence and has been registered for temporary residence.

10. Current place of residence is the place of permanent residence or temporary residence where the citizen is regularly living; in case there is no permanent place of residence or temporary place of residence, the current place of residence is the place where the citizen is actually living.

Luật Trồng trọt@2:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Horticulture is an economic - technical branch of agriculture related to the cultivation of crops. agricultural crops, ornamental plants and edible mushrooms for human purposes.

2. Cultivation activities include activities on plant varieties; fertilizers; cultivation; harvesting, preliminary processing and preservation. , processing, trading and quality control of crop products.

3. Farming is the process by which people use natural resources, agricultural equipment and materials, and apply production processes. to make different crop products.

4. Crop products are the harvested parts of agricultural crops, ornamental plants, and edible mushrooms.

5. A plant variety is a population of plants. distinguishable from other plant populations by the expression of at least one trait and passable to the next generation; morphologically uniform, stable over propagation cycles; of cultural value effects, use values; including agricultural plant varieties, medicinal plant varieties, ornamental plant varieties and edible mushroom varieties.

6. Propagation material is a plant or part of a plant, an edible mushroom or a part of an edible mushroom that can develop into a new individual, used for propagation or for sowing.

7. The main plant species is the commonly grown tree species, which is important in economic development, and should be strictly managed.

8. Annual plants are plants that are planted, harvested and finished in a production cycle within a period of no more than 01 year, including annuals that are kept at the root.

9. Perennial crops are plants that are planted once, grown for many years, and harvested one or more times.

10. Varietal distinctiveness is the ability of a plant variety to clearly distinguish a variety from well-known cultivars.

11. The homogeneity of a plant variety is the expression of the same plant variety in terms of related traits, except for deviations within the allowable range for some specific traits during propagation.

12. Plant variety stability is the steady expression of the relevant traits as originally described, which is not altered after each propagation season or after each propagation cycle in the case of cyclic propagation. 

13. Plant variety testing is an activity of monitoring and evaluating criteria to determine the distinctiveness, uniformity, stability, cultivation value and use value of plant varieties according to certain methods. n
14. Controlled trial means testing a plant variety in an artificial environment so that the plant variety can fully demonstrate its resistance to harmful organisms and adverse conditions.

15. Fertilizer trial is an activity of monitoring and evaluating criteria in order to determine the use method, environmental impact, agronomic efficiency and economic efficiency of fertilizer.

16. Narrow field trial is a field trial, with a small plot area, repeated, and arranged according to national standards on testing methods for tested subjects.

17. A large-scale trial is a field trial, with a large plot area, without repetition, and arranged according to national standards on testing methods for tested subjects.

18. A flagship tree is the best tree selected and recognized from the population of a cultivar .

19. First-line orchard is an orchard that is multiplied from a leading tree or an orchard established and recognized by an organization or individual.

20. Fertilizer is a product that has the function of providing nutrients or improving the soil to increase yield and quality for plants.

21. Fertilizer quality criteria are specifications on characteristics, composition, and content reflecting the quality of fertilizers specified in the respective published technical regulations and standards.

22. Nutrient elements in fertilizers are chemical elements necessary for the growth and development of plants.

This Law prescribes activities to protect national security and ensure social order and safety in cyberspace; responsibilities of agencies, organizations and individuals relevant person.
Luật An ninh mạng@2:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Cybersecurity is the assurance that operations in cyberspace do not compromise security. national security, social order and safety, and legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals.

2. Cybersecurity protection means prevention, detection, containment, handling. acts of infringing upon network security.

3. Cyberspace is the connection network of information technology infrastructure, including telecommunications network, Internet, computer network, information system, system Information processing and control system, database; a place where people perform social behaviors that are not limited by space and time.

4. National cyberspace is cyberspace. established, managed and controlled by the Government.

5. National cyber infrastructure is a system of physical and technical foundations for creating, transmitting, collecting, processing, storing and storing. Information storage and exchange in national cyberspace, including:

a) Transmission system includes national transmission system, international connection transmission system, satellite system, system transmission of service providers on telecommunications networks, the Internet, and value-added services in cyberspace;

b) Core service system including national information navigation and navigation system country, the national domain name resolution system (DNS), the national authentication system (PKI/CA) and the Internet access and connection service provider system of service providers on the telecommunications network, the Internet, value-added services in cyberspace;

c) Information technology services and applications including online services; application of information technology with network connection in service of management and administration of important agencies, organizations and economic and financial groups; national database.

Online services include e-government, e-commerce, websites, online forums, social networks, blogs;

d) information technology infrastructure of smart cities, Internet of things, complex real-virtual systems, cloud computing, big data systems, fast data systems and artificial intelligence systems.
 
6. The international network gateway is the place where network signal transmission and reception takes place between Vietnam and other countries and territories.

7. Cybercrime is the act of using cyberspace, information technology or electronic means to commit crimes specified in the Penal Code.

8. Cyberattack is an act of using cyberspace, information technology or electronic means to sabotage or disrupt the operation of telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, processing systems, and the like. information management and control, databases, electronic media.

9. Cyber terrorism is the use of cyberspace, information technology or electronic means to commit acts of terrorism, to finance terrorism.

10. Cyber espionage is the intentional act of bypassing warnings, access codes, passwords, firewalls, using other people's administrative rights or using other methods to illegally appropriate and collect information and information resources. information on telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases and electronic means of agencies, organizations and individuals.

11. A digital account is information used for authentication, authentication, and authorization to use applications and services in cyberspace.

12. Cybersecurity threat is a situation in which cyberspace appears to threaten to infringe upon national security, seriously damage social order and safety, and legitimate rights and interests of agencies and organizations. organization, individual.

13. A cybersecurity incident is an unexpected event occurring in cyberspace that infringes upon national security, social order and safety, and legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals.

14. A dangerous cyber security situation is an event that occurs in cyberspace when there is a serious act of infringing upon national security, causing particularly serious harm to social order and safety, and legitimate rights and interests. laws of agencies, organizations and individuals.

Luật Chăn nuôi@2:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Livestock production is an economic-technical branch that includes activities in the field of animal breeds. animal husbandry, animal feed, breeding conditions, processing and marketing of livestock products.

2. Livestock activities are raising, raising and breeding livestock and other activities related to animals. livestock, livestock products for the purpose of food, traction, ornamental or other human purposes.

3. Household husbandry is a form of organizing livestock production activities at households. family.

4. Farming is a form of organizing livestock production activities in a separate area for livestock production and business.

5. Livestock includes cattle and livestock. poultry and other animals in livestock.

6. Cattle are mammals with 04 legs that are domesticated and raised by humans.

7. Poultry are animals with 02 legs. legged, feathered, winged animals domesticated and raised by man.

8. Other animals in husbandry are animals other than cattle and poultry and outside the List of endangered, precious and rare species prioritized for protection, the List of endangered, precious and rare forest animals, common forest animals, aquatic animals, the list of wild animals in the Appendix to the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora.

9. Livestock breed is a population of livestock of the same species, of the same origin, with similar appearance and genetic structure, formed, consolidated and developed by human influence; there must be a guaranteed quantity to propagate and pass on the traits of the breed to the next generation.

10. A lineage is a group of domestic animals within the breed, which shares common characteristics of the breed but has its own stable characteristics.

11. New livestock lines and breeds are livestock strains and breeds created for the first time in the country or imported for the first time into Vietnam.

12. Precious and rare livestock breeds are livestock breeds of special scientific, medical, and economic value, whose numbers are small or threatened with extinction.

13. Indigenous livestock breeds are livestock breeds that are formed and exist in a certain area in the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.

14. The original breed is a herd of great-grandparents and grandparents for pigs and poultry; nuclear breed herd for other cattle breeds; purebred flocks of bees; protozoa for silkworms.

15. Grandparent-level breed herd for pigs and poultry is a herd of purebred livestock or a breed herd that has been selected to produce grandparent-level breed herds.

16. Grandparent-level breed herd for pigs and poultry is a herd of livestock breeders born from the breed herd of great-grandparents level to produce parental breed herds.

17. Parent-level breed herd for pigs and poultry means livestock breed herds born from grandparents-level breeding herds to produce commercial flocks.

18. The nuclear breed herd is the best breed, has a clear origin and origin, is nurtured and selected according to a certain process in order to achieve high genetic progress to produce breeding herds.

19. Breeding herd is a breed herd produced by a nuclear breed herd for commercial production or selected to be added to a nuclear breed herd.

20. A commercial herd is a herd of livestock born from a parental breed herd or from a breeding herd.

21. Livestock genetic resources are living animals and their breeding products that carry genetic information capable of creating or participating in the creation of new livestock breeds.

22. A pet pedigree is a record of an individual's blood relationship with their ancestors.

23. Livestock breeding products include breeding stock, sperm, embryos, breeding eggs, larvae and other genetic material extracted from livestock.

24. Breeding of livestock means selecting and mating or using scientific methods and technical measures to create a new line or breed of livestock.

25. Animal feed is the product that animals eat and drink in fresh, raw or processed form, including complete feed, concentrate, supplementary feed and traditional feed.
 
26. Complete feed is a mixture of formulated feed ingredients that have sufficient nutrients to sustain the animal's survival and production capacity at each growth stage or production cycle without no need to add food other than water.

27. Concentrated feed is a mixture of feed ingredients with a nutrient content higher than the animal's needs and used to combine with other ingredients to form a complete compound feed.

28. Complementary feed is a single ingredient or a mixture of feed ingredients added to the diet to balance the nutrients needed for livestock; maintain or improve the characteristics of the feed; improve animal health, livestock product characteristics.

29. Traditional feeds are agricultural, aquatic, and industrial products that are commonly used in animal husbandry, including paddy, rice, bran, maize, potato, cassava, wine residue, beer residue, and cassava residues. , pineapple residue, molasses, straw, grass, shrimp, crab, fish and other similar products.

30. Single ingredients are substances in natural or synthetic form used as feed ingredients.

31. Commercial animal feed is animal feed produced for the purpose of exchange, purchase and sale in the market.

32. The main substance in animal feed is the substance that determines the use and nature of the feed.

33. Livestock products include meat, eggs, milk, honey, beeswax, silkworm cocoons, bird's nests, bones, horns, nails and organs; unprocessed fur, hides and other products extracted from livestock.

Administrative procedural law contributes to the protection of justice, protection of human rights, citizens' rights, and protection of the socialist regime. protect the interests of the State, the legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals; educate people to strictly abide by the law; ensure the stability, transparency and effectiveness of the economy national administration.

The statute of limitations for complaints is 10 days from the date the complainant receives or learns of a decision or procedural act that he or she believes is illegal.

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@331:

The complaint must be made in writing. The complaint must clearly state the date, month, year; full name, address of the complainant; content, reason due to the complaint or request of the complainant, signed or fingerprinted by the complainant.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@332:

Complaints Appeal against the first-time complaint settlement decision of the Chief Justice of the Court, the Chief Procurator of the Procuracy specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article by the Chief Justice of the immediate superior court, the Chief Procurator of the immediate superior procuracies. handle.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@333:

Time limit for first-time complaint settlement is 15 days from the date the Court or Procuracy receives the complaint. If the substance is complicated, the time limit for complaint settlement may be extended but must not exceed 15 days from the date of expiration of the time limit for complaint settlement.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@335:

Within 05 working days from the date the complainant receives the first complaint settlement decision, if he disagrees with that decision or past the time limit specified in Article 333 of this Law, if the complaint is not settled, the complainant has the right to lodge a complaint with a person competent to settle complaints for the second time.

a) Contents specified at points a, b, c, d and e, Clause 1, Article 334 of this Law;

b) Results of complaint settlement of the first-time complaint settler;

c) Conclusion on each specific issue in the content of the complainant's complaint and the settlement of the second-time complaint.

4. The second-time complaint settlement decision must be sent to the complainant, agency, organization or individual. related persons; in case it is a decision of the Chief Justice of the Court, it must also be sent to the Procuracy of the same level.

5. The second-time complaint settlement decision takes effect.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@336:

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@337:
Person with the right to denunciation

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@340:

In case the denounced person is the Chief Justice, Deputy Chief Justice of the Court, the Procurator, or Deputy Director of the Procuracy, the Chief Justice of the immediate superior court, the Chief Procurator of the Procuracy the immediate superior is responsible for settlement.

The time limit for denunciation settlement is 60 days from the date of receipt of the denunciation; for complicated cases, the time limit for denunciation settlement may be longer, but not more than 90 days.

2. Denunciations about illegal acts showing criminal signs shall be settled according to the provisions of the Criminal Procedure Code.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@341:
Denunciation settlement procedures

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@342:

2. Persons competent to settle complaints and denunciations but fail to settle them or lack responsibility in illegal settlement or settlement, depending on the nature, the seriousness of the violation, they will be disciplined or examined for penal liability; if causing damage, they must pay compensation according to the provisions of law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@343:
To supervise the observance of the law in the settlement of complaints and denunciations in administrative proceedings

1. Court cost advances include first-instance court cost advances and appellate court cost advances.

2. Court judgments Fees include first-instance court costs and appellate court fees.

3. Fees include fees for granting copies of court judgments, decisions and other papers and other fees prescribed by law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@345:

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@346:

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@347:

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@348:

2. Before opening a court session, the Court conducts a dialogue, if the involved parties have a successful dialogue on the settlement of the case, they will only have to bear 50% of the first-instance court fee rate specified in Clause 1 of this Article. Clause 1 of this Article.

Luật Tố tụng hành chính@349:

2. In case the appellate court amends the first-instance judgment or decision which is appealed, the appealing involved parties are not required to pay the appellate court fee; The appellate court must re-determine the obligation to pay first-instance court fees as prescribed in Article 348 of this Law.

3. In case the appellate court cancels the appealed first-instance judgment or decision for first-instance trial. The appellate court fee shall not be paid by the appellate involved parties; the obligation to pay the court fees shall be re-determined upon the first-instance re-settlement of the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@350:

Governing scope
This law prescribes the marriage and family regime; legal standards for behavior among family members; responsibilities of individuals, organizations, the State and society society in building and consolidating the marriage and family regime.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@2:
Basic principles of marriage and family system
1. Voluntary, progressive, monogamous, equal husband and wife.

2. Marriage between Vietnamese citizens Men of all ethnicities and religions, between religious followers and non-believers, between believers and non-believers, between Vietnamese citizens and foreigners are respected and protected by law. protection.

3. Building a prosperous, progressive and happy family; family members are obliged to respect, care for, care for and help each other; not to discriminate between children. 

4. The State, society and family have the responsibility to protect and support children, the elderly and people with disabilities to exercise their rights to marriage and family; and to help mothers to perform well. noble function of the mother; implementation of family planning.

5. Inheriting and promoting the fine cultural and ethical traditions of the Vietnamese nation on marriage and family.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@3:
Explanation of terms
In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Marriage is the relationship between husband and wife after marriage.

2. Family means a collection of people bound together by marriage, blood relation or nurturing relationship, giving rise to their rights and obligations to each other in accordance with this Law.

3. Marriage regime Marriage and divorce are all provisions of the law on marriage and divorce; rights and obligations between husband and wife, between parents and children, among other family members; alimony; identification of fathers. , mother, child; marriage and family relations with foreign elements and other issues related to marriage and family.

4. Customs of marriage and family are rules of conduct clear content on the rights and obligations of the parties in marriage and family relations, repeated over a long period of time and widely recognized in a region, region or community.

5. Marriage is when a man and a woman establish a husband and wife relationship with each other according to the provisions of this Law on marriage conditions and marriage registration.

6. Illegal marriage is when a man and woman have registered their marriage at a competent state agency but one or both parties violate the conditions for marriage as prescribed in Article 8 of this Law.

7 . Living together as husband and wife is the act of men and women organizing their lives together and treating each other as husband and wife.

8. Child marriage means getting married or getting married when one or both parties are under the marriageable age as prescribed at Point a, Clause 1, Article 8 of this Law.

9. Forced marriage or divorce is the act of intimidation, mental intimidation, torture, ill-treatment, property claim or other behavior to force another person to marry or divorce against their will.
 
10. Obstructing marriage or divorce means threatening, mentally intimidating, tormenting, ill-treating, claiming property or other acts to prevent the marriage of a person who is eligible to get married in accordance with this Law. this or force others to maintain a marriage relationship against their will.

11. Fake marriage means taking advantage of marriage to exit, enter, reside or naturalize Vietnamese or foreign nationality; enjoy the State's preferential regime or to achieve other purposes other than the purpose of building a family.

12. Claiming wealth in marriage is an excessive material requirement and considers it a condition for marriage in order to hinder the voluntary marriage of men and women.

13. Marriage period is the period of existence of husband and wife relationship, calculated from the date of marriage registration to the date of marriage termination.

14. Divorce is the termination of the husband and wife relationship according to a legally effective judgment or decision of the Court.

15. Fraudulent divorce is the use of divorce to evade property obligations, violate policies and laws on population, or to achieve other purposes that are not intended to terminate the marriage.

16. Family members include husband and wife; natural parents, adoptive parents, stepfather, stepmother, parents-in-law, parents-in-law; natural, adopted, step-child of a spouse, daughter-in-law, son-in-law; brother, sister, half-brother, brother-in-law, half-brother, half-brother, half-brother, brother-in-law, brother-in-law, sister-in-law, sister-in-law , with a different mother; paternal grandparents, maternal grandparents; grandson, grandchild; aunt, uncle, uncle, aunt and nephew.

17. People of the same direct bloodline are those who are related by blood, in which one person gives birth to the other one after another.

18. Those who have surnames within three generations are people of the same origin, including parents who are the first generation; brothers, sisters, brothers with the same parents, the same father, the same mother, the second generation; brother, sister, brother, uncle, aunt, uncle, aunt is the third generation.

19. Relatives are those who are related by marriage or adoption, who have the same direct bloodline, and who have the last name within three generations.

20. Essential needs are the usual daily needs for food, clothing, accommodation, study, medical examination and treatment and other common daily needs that are indispensable for the life of each person, each family.
 
21. Assisted reproductive technology is the birth of a baby by artificial insemination or in vitro fertilization.

22. Humanitarian surrogacy is when a woman voluntarily, not for commercial purposes, helps a couple to become pregnant for a couple whose wife is unable to conceive and give birth even though assisted reproductive technology is applied. fertility, by taking the wife's ovum and the husband's sperm for in vitro fertilization, and then implanting it into the uterus of a woman who voluntarily becomes pregnant so that she becomes pregnant and gives birth.

23. Commercial surrogacy is a woman's pregnancy for another person using assisted reproductive technology for economic or other benefit.

24. Support is the obligation of a person to contribute money or other property to meet the essential needs of a person who is not living with him or her but has a marriage, blood or foster relationship in case that person is an unmarried person. minors, adult people without working capacity and no property to support themselves, or people facing difficulties or needy under the provisions of this Law.

25. Marriage and family relations involving foreign elements are marriage and family relations in which at least one party is a foreigner or a Vietnamese residing abroad; marriage and family relations between the parties involved are Vietnamese citizens, but the grounds for establishing, changing or terminating such relationship according to foreign laws, arising abroad or property related to the relationship that system is abroad.

Bộ luật dân sự@89:
Merger of a legal entity

1. A legal entity may be merged (hereinafter referred to as the merged legal entity) into another legal entity (hereinafter referred to as the merged legal entity).

2. After the merger, the merged juridical person ceases to exist; the civil rights and obligations of the merged juridical person are transferred to the merging juridical person.
Bộ luật dân sự@90:
Dividing a legal entity

1. A legal person can be divided into many legal entities.

2. After the division, the divided legal entity ceases to exist; the legal rights and civil obligations the divided individual is transferred to the new legal entity.
Bộ luật dân sự@91:
Separation of legal entities

1. A legal entity may be divided into several legal entities.

2. After separation, the separated legal entity and the separated legal entity exercise civil rights and obligations. be fit for the purpose of its operation.
Bộ luật dân sự@92:
Converting the form of a legal entity

1. A legal person can be converted into another legal entity.

2. After the form conversion, the converted legal entity terminates exist from the time the converted legal person is established; the converted legal person inherits the civil rights and obligations of the converted legal person.
Bộ luật dân sự@94:
Payment of assets of the dissolved legal entity

1. The assets of the dissolved legal entity shall be paid in the following order:

a) Dissolution costs;

b) Debts in salary, severance allowance, social insurance, health insurance for employees in accordance with the law and other benefits of employees under the collective labor agreement and signed labor contract;

c) Tax debt and other debts.

In case there is no other fund with the same operational purpose to receive the transferred assets. or the fund is dissolved due to activities that violate the prohibition of the law or are contrary to social morality, the assets of the dissolved fund belong to the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@95:
Bankruptcy of a legal entity

The bankruptcy of a legal person is carried out in accordance with the bankruptcy law.
Bộ luật dân sự@96:
Termination of legal entity

1. A legal entity shall cease to exist in the following cases:

a) Consolidation, merger, division, transformation, dissolution of a legal entity as prescribed in articles 88, 89, 90, 92 and 93 of this Code;

b) Being declared bankrupt in accordance with the bankruptcy law.

2. The legal person ceases to exist. from the time the name is deleted from the register of legal entities or from the time determined in a decision of a competent state agency.

3. When the legal person ceases to exist, the property of the legal person shall be settled in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws.

State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, state agencies At the central and local levels, when participating in civil relations, they are equal with other subjects and bear civil liability according to the provisions of Articles 99 and 100 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@98:
Representatives participating in civil relations

The representation of the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local state agencies in civil relations is carried out The representation through other individuals and legal entities shall only be performed in accordance with the law on functions, tasks, powers and organizational structure of state agencies. , the procedure prescribed by law.

The State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local state agencies are not responsible for the civil obligations of the legal entities they establish. , including state-owned enterprises, unless the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, the central state agency, or the locality guarantees the civil obligations of this legal entity in accordance with the provisions of law. law.

4. State agencies at the central and local levels are not responsible for the civil obligations of the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, other central or local state agencies, except for cases where relevant laws are not applicable. other regulations.
Bộ luật dân sự@101:
The subject in civil relations with the participation of households, cooperative groups, and other organizations without legal status

In the case of households, cooperative groups, and organizations When other organizations without legal status participate in civil relations, members of households, cooperative groups and other organizations without legal status are subjects to participate in establishing and performing civil transactions. or authorize a representative to participate in the establishment and performance of civil transactions. The authorization must be made in writing, unless otherwise agreed. know.

2. The determination of the subject of the civil relationship with the participation of the land-using household is carried out. accordance with the provisions of the Land Law.
Bộ luật dân sự@102:
Common property of household members, cooperative groups, other organizations without legal status

1. Determination of common property of household members, rights, the obligations to this property shall be determined according to the provisions of Article 212 of this Code.

2. The determination of the common property of the members of the cooperative group, the rights and obligations to this property shall be determined by the determination of the common property of the members of the cooperative group. determined according to the provisions of Article 506 of this Code.

3. The determination of common property of members of another organization without legal status, rights and obligations to this property shall be determined. as agreed upon by the members, unless otherwise provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@103:
Civil liability of members of households, cooperative groups, and other organizations without legal status

Bộ luật dân sự@104:
Legal consequences for civil transactions established or performed by a member who does not have the right to represent or exceeds the scope of representation

1. In case a member does not have the right to represent, establishment and performance of civil transactions in the name of other members of households, cooperative groups, other organizations without legal status, or representatives that establish or perform beyond the scope of representation, The legal consequences of the transaction shall be applied in accordance with the provisions of Articles 130, 142 and 143 of this Code.

Bộ luật dân sự@105:
Property

1. Property is things, money, valuable papers and property rights.

2. Property includes real property and movable property. Real estate and movable property. can be existing assets and future assets.
Bộ luật dân sự@106:
Property registration

1. Ownership and other rights to property being real property are registered in accordance with this Code and the law on property registration.

2. Ownership rights and other rights to movable property are not required to be registered, unless otherwise provided for by the law on property registration.

3. The registration of property must be made public.
Bộ luật dân sự@108:
Existing assets and assets to be formed in the future

1. Existing assets are assets that have been formed and the subject has established ownership and other rights to the property before or at the time of establishing the transaction.

2. Assets to be formed in the future include:

a) Assets that have not yet been formed;

b) Assets that have been formed but the subject establishes rights owning the property after the transaction is established.
Bộ luật dân sự@109:
Yield, interest

1. Yield is the natural product of the property.

2. Yield is the profit obtained from the exploitation of the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@110:
Main object and auxiliary object

1. The main object is an independent object that can be used according to its features.

2. An auxiliary object is an object that directly serves the exploitation of the public. use of the main object, which is a part of the main object, but can be separated from the main object.

3. When performing the obligation to transfer the main object, the auxiliary object must also be transferred, unless otherwise agreed .
Bộ luật dân sự@111:
Divisible and indivisible objects

1. A divisible object is an object that, when divided, retains its original properties and uses.

2. Indivisible object is When an object is divided, its original properties and uses cannot be preserved.

When it is necessary to divide an indivisible object, it must be valued in money to divide.
Bộ luật dân sự@112:
Consumables and non-consumables

1. Consumables are objects that, after being used once, lose or do not retain their original properties, shapes and functions of use. 

Consumables cannot be the subject of a lease or loan agreement.

2. A non-consumable item is an object that, after being used many times, basically retains its properties and shape. original appearance and performance.
Bộ luật dân sự@113:
Objects of the same type and specific objects

1. Objects of the same type are objects that have the same shape, properties, uses and functions and can be determined by measuring units.

Objects of the same type. of the same type of the same quality can be substituted for each other.

2. A distinctive object is an object that is distinguished from other objects by its own distinctive characteristics of symbol, shape, color, material, characteristic. , location.

When performing the obligation to deliver a particular object, the correct object must be delivered.
Bộ luật dân sự@114:
A synchronized object

A synchronized object is an object consisting of interrelated and interrelated parts or parts forming a whole which, if one of the parts, parts, or parts, is missing, is present. If the part is not in accordance with the specifications and type, it cannot be used or its use value is reduced.

When performing the obligation to deliver the synchronized object, the whole part or parts must be transferred. incorporated, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@115:
Property rights

Property rights are rights valued in money, including property rights to objects of intellectual property rights, land use rights and other property rights.
Bộ luật dân sự@116:
Civil transaction

Civil transaction is a contract or unilateral legal act that gives rise to, changes or terminates civil rights and obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@119:
Form of civil transactions

1.Civil transactions are expressed verbally, in writing or by specific acts.

Civil transactions through electronic means in the form of data messages according to the provisions of the law on electronic transactions is considered a written transaction.

2. Where the law stipulates that a civil transaction must be presented in a valid written document. evidence, certification, registration must comply with such provisions.
Bộ luật dân sự@120:
Conditional civil transaction

1. If the parties agree on the conditions for arising or canceling the civil transaction, when such condition occurs, the civil transaction will arise. or cancel.

2. Where the condition giving rise to or canceling a civil transaction cannot happen due to one party's intentional act of directly or indirectly obstructing, such condition shall be deemed to have been fulfilled. occurs; in case there is a direct or indirect influence of a party to intentionally promote the occurrence of a condition, such condition shall be deemed to have not occurred.
Bộ luật dân sự@122:
Civil transactions are invalid

Civil transactions that do not meet one of the conditions specified in Article 117 of this Code are invalid, unless otherwise provided for by this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@123:
Civil transactions are invalid due to violation of the prohibition of the law, contrary to social morality

Civil transactions with purposes and contents violating the prohibition of the law, contrary to social morality, then null and void.

A prohibition of a law is a provision of the law that does not allow the subject to perform certain acts.

Social ethics are the general standards of conduct in social life, which are established by the law. community acknowledges and respects.
Bộ luật dân sự@124:
Civil transactions are invalid due to forgery

1. When the parties artificially establish civil transactions in order to conceal another civil transaction, the fake civil transactions are invalidated , while concealed civil transactions are still valid, unless such transactions are also invalid under the provisions of this Code or other relevant laws.

2. In case of establishment of civil transactions falsified in order to evade obligations to a third party, such civil transaction shall be void.
Bộ luật dân sự@126:
Civil transactions are invalid due to confusion

1. In case a civil transaction is established by mistake, one party or parties cannot achieve the purpose of establishing the transaction. the mistaken party has the right to request the court to declare the civil transaction invalid, except for the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article.

2. The civil transaction established by mistake is not invalid. in case the purpose of establishing civil transactions of the parties has been achieved or the parties can immediately remedy the confusion so that the purpose of establishing civil transactions is still achieved.
Bộ luật dân sự@127:
Civil transactions are invalid due to deception, intimidation or coercion

When a party participates in a civil transaction due to deception or threat or coercion, they have the right to request the Court The court declares that the civil transaction is invalid.

Deception in a civil transaction is an intentional act of one party or a third party in order to mislead the other party about the subject and nature of the transaction. The object or content of a civil transaction should have established that transaction.

Threat, coercion in a civil transaction is an intentional act of a party or a third person to force the other party to do so. performing civil transactions in order to avoid loss of life, health, honor, reputation, dignity, property or those of one's relatives.
Bộ luật dân sự@128:
Civil transactions are invalid because the originator is not aware of and controls his actions

The person who has civil act capacity but has established the transaction at the right time is not aware and have control over their actions, they have the right to request the Court to declare that civil transaction invalid.
Bộ luật dân sự@129:
Civil transactions that are invalid due to failure to comply with regulations on formality

Civil transactions that violate regulations on valid conditions for formality shall be invalid, except for the following cases: n
1. A civil transaction that has been established in accordance with regulations must be in writing but the document is not in accordance with the provisions of law and one party or parties has performed at least two-thirds of the obligations in the transaction. At the request of one party or parties, the Court shall issue a decision to recognize the validity of such transaction;

2. The civil transaction has been established in writing but violates mandatory regulations on notarization and certification. In this case, at the request of either party or parties, the Court shall issue a decision to recognize the validity of that transaction. the parties are not required to perform the notarization and authentication.
Bộ luật dân sự@130:
Civil transactions are partially invalidated

Civil transactions are partially invalidated when part of the content of a civil transaction is invalidated but does not affect the validity of the rest of the transaction .
Bộ luật dân sự@131:
Legal consequences of invalid civil transactions

1. Invalid civil transactions do not give rise to, change, or terminate civil rights and obligations of the parties from the time on the transaction is established.

2. When a civil transaction is invalidated, the parties will restore to the original state and return to each other what they have received.

In case it is not possible to return by present The object is worth the money to be returned.

3. The party that is righteous in the collection of the yield or profit is not required to return such yield or profit.

4. The party at fault causing the damage is must pay compensation.

5. The settlement of consequences of invalid civil transactions related to moral rights shall be prescribed by this Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@133:
Protecting the interests of a bona fide third party when civil transactions are invalidated

1. In case a civil transaction is invalid but the object of the transaction is a non-registered property that has been transferred to a bona fide third party, the transaction established and performed with the third party shall still be valid, except for the case specified in Article 167 of this Code.

2. In the case of civil transactions invalid but the property has been registered at a competent state agency, then transferred by another civil transaction to a bona fide third party who establishes, based on that registration, If the property has to be registered but has not yet been registered at a competent state agency, the civil transaction with the third party will be invalid, except in case a bona fide third person receives this property through auction at a competent organization or transaction with a person who, according to a judgment or decision of a competent state agency, is the owner of the property but then this subject is not the owner of the property because the judgment or decision is canceled or corrected.

3. The owner does not have the right to reclaim the property from a bona fide third party, if the civil transaction with this person is not invalidated as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article, but has the right to initiate a lawsuit or request that the owner is at fault. to the transaction entered into with a third party must reimburse reasonable costs and compensate for damages.
Bộ luật dân sự@134:
Representation

1. Representation means an individual or legal entity (hereinafter collectively referred to as a representative) on behalf of and for the benefit of another individual or legal entity (hereinafter collectively referred to as 'representative'). representative) establishes and performs civil transactions.

2. Individuals and legal entities may establish and perform civil transactions through their representatives. represent themselves if required by law they must establish and perform such transactions by themselves.

3. In case of law, the representative must have civil legal capacity, civil act capacity conformity with civil transactions is established and performed.
Bộ luật dân sự@135:
Base for establishment of representation rights

Authorized representatives are established by authorization between the represented person and the representative (hereinafter referred to as authorized representative); according to the decision of the agency competent state agency, according to the charter of the legal person or according to the provisions of law (hereinafter referred to as the legal representative).
Bộ luật dân sự@136:
A legal representative of an individual

1. Father and mother in respect of a minor child.

2. Guardian in respect of a ward. difficulty in perception and behavior control is the legal representative if appointed by the Court.

3. The person appointed by the Court in case the representative cannot be identified as prescribed in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article.

4. A person appointed by a court for a person with restricted civil act capacity.
Bộ luật dân sự@138:
Authorized representative

1. An individual or legal entity may authorize another individual or legal entity to establish and perform civil transactions.

2. Household members Families, cooperative groups, and other organizations without legal status may agree to appoint another individual or legal entity to represent under authorization to establish and perform civil transactions related to the common property of members. members of households, cooperative groups and other organizations without legal status.

3. Persons between full fifteen years of age and under eighteen years of age may be authorized representatives, except in legal cases. The law stipulates that civil transactions must be established and performed by persons aged full eighteen years or older.
Bộ luật dân sự@139:
Legal consequences of the act of representation

1. Civil transactions established and performed by the representative with a third party in accordance with the scope of representation give rise to rights and obligations. against the represented person.

2. The representative has the right to establish and perform the acts necessary to achieve the purpose of the representation.

3. Where the representative knows or ought to know The establishment of an act of representation due to confusion, deception, threat or coercion but still establishing and performing the act does not give rise to rights and obligations towards the represented person, except where the agent knew or ought to have known about it without objecting.
Bộ luật dân sự@142:
Consequences of civil transactions established and performed by an unauthorized person

1. Civil transactions established and performed by an unauthorized person do not give rise to rights , obligations towards the principal, except for one of the following cases:

a) The principal has acknowledged the transaction;

b) The principal knows without objection in a reasonable time limit;

c) The principal is at fault resulting in the fact that the person who transacted did not know or could not know that the person who established and performed civil transactions with him or her did not have the right to represent. 

2. In case a civil transaction established and performed by a person without the right of representation does not give rise to rights and obligations towards the represented person, the person without the right of representation must still perform the obligations. against the person who has transacted with him, unless the person who has transacted knows or ought to know about not having the right to represent and still transacts.

3. unilaterally terminate the performance or cancel the established civil transaction and claim compensation for damage, unless such person knows or ought to know that he or she does not have the right to represent but still conducts the transaction or the case specified in Clause 1 of this Article. point a, clause 1 of this Article.

4. In case the person without the right to represent and the person who did the transaction intentionally establishes and performs a civil transaction, causing damage to the represented person, he/she must be jointly responsible for compensating for the damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@143:
Consequences of civil transactions established and performed by the representative beyond the scope of the representative

1. The civil transactions established and performed by the representative exceed the scope of the representative the representation does not give rise to the rights and obligations of the principal with respect to the part of the transaction performed beyond the scope of the representation, except in one of the following cases:

a) The principal agrees; 

b) The agent knew without objecting within a reasonable time;

c) The principal was at fault which resulted in the fact that the person doing the transaction did not know or could not know about the confirmed person. establish and perform civil transactions with them beyond the scope of representation.

2. In case a civil transaction established or performed by a representative exceeds the scope of representation, it does not give rise to rights and obligations. If the representative's services are performed beyond the scope of the representation, the representative must perform the obligations towards the person who has transacted with him for the part of the transaction beyond the scope of representation. , unless the person who transacted knew or ought to have known about going beyond the scope of representation and still transacted.

3. The person who has transacted with the representative has the right to unilaterally terminate the performance or cancel the civil transaction for the part beyond the scope of representation or the entire civil transaction and demand compensation for damage, except for such person knows or ought to know about exceeding the scope of representation but still transacts or in the case specified at point a, clause 1 of this Article.

4. In case the representative and the person dealing with the representative intentionally establish and perform civil transactions beyond the scope of representation, causing damage to the represented person, they must be jointly responsible for compensating for the damage. .
Bộ luật dân sự@144:
Duration

1. Duration is a specified period of time from one point to another.

2. Duration can be specified in minutes, hours, days, week, month, year or by a probable event.
Bộ luật dân sự@145:
Application of time limit calculation

1. Time limit calculation method shall be applied in accordance with the provisions of this Code, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law.

2 . The time limit is calculated according to the solar calendar, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@147:
Starting time of duration

1. When duration is specified in minutes, hours, duration is started from specified time.

2. When duration is specified equal to day, week, month, year, the first day of the period is not counted, but counted from the next day adjacent to the specified date.

3. When the time limit begins with an event, the date on which the event occurred. The event is not counted but counted from the next day immediately following the date on which the event occurs.
Bộ luật dân sự@148:
Terminate end

1. When the time limit is in days, the time limit ends at the end of the last day of the time limit.

2. When the time limit is in weeks, the time limit will end at the end of the last day of the time limit.

2. term ends at the end of the corresponding day of the last week of the term.

3. When a period is in months, the term ends at the end of the corresponding day of the last month of the term. ; if the expiration month does not have a corresponding date, the time limit ends on the last day of that month.

4. When the time limit is in years, the time limit ends at the end of the corresponding day or month. response of the last year of the term.

5. When the last day of the period is a weekend or public holiday, the time limit ends at the end of the working day following that holiday.

6. The end of the last day of the period shall be at twenty-four hours of that day.
Bộ luật dân sự@149:
Statute of limitations

1. A statute of limitations is a time limit prescribed by law, upon the end of which, legal consequences arise for the subject under the conditions prescribed by law.

The statute of limitations shall be applied in accordance with the provisions of this Code and other relevant laws.

2. The court shall apply the statute of limitations only upon the request of one or both parties to apply the statute of limitations on the condition that this request must be made before the first-instance Court issues a judgment or decision to resolve the case or matter.
The person benefiting from the application of the statute of limitations has the right to refuse to apply the statute of limitations, except in cases where the statute of limitations is not applicable. such refusal is for the purpose of evading the performance of the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@150:
Types of statute of limitations

1. Statute of limitations for enjoyment of civil rights is a time-limit within which the subject enjoys civil rights upon the end of which.

2. Statute of limitations for exemption from obligations. civil obligation is a time-limit within which the civil obligor is exempted from performing the obligation upon the end of which time limit.

3 Civil case settlement judgments protect infringed lawful rights and interests; if such time limit expires, the right to initiate lawsuits shall be lost.

4. The statute of limitations for requesting the resolution of civil matters is the time limit within which the owner of the civil case is required to settle. may request the Court to settle a civil matter in order to protect the legitimate rights and interests of individuals, legal entities, national and national interests, or public interests; if such time limit expires, the rights shall be lost. request.
Bộ luật dân sự@151:
Status calculation

The statute of limitations is calculated from the start of the first day of the statute of limitations and ends at the end of the last day of the statute of limitations.
Bộ luật dân sự@152:
Effectiveness of the statute of limitations for enjoyment of civil rights and exemption from civil obligations

In cases where the law provides for subjects to enjoy civil rights or to be exempt from civil obligations according to the statute of limitations only after that statute of limitations has expired, will the enjoyment of civil rights or immunity from civil obligations take effect.
Bộ luật dân sự@153:
Continuity of the statute of limitations for enjoyment of civil rights and exemption from civil obligations

1. Statute of limitations for enjoyment of civil rights and exemption from civil obligations is continuous from the beginning until the date of termination. at the end; if there is an interrupting event, the statute of limitations must be recalculated from the beginning, after the interrupting event ends.

2. The statute of limitations for enjoyment of civil rights and immunity from civil obligations is terminated. interrupted when there is one of the following events:

a) There is a resolution by a legally effective decision of a competent state agency with respect to the civil rights and obligations being applied statute of limitations;

b) Civil rights and obligations being subject to the statute of limitations are disputed by persons with related rights and obligations and have been resolved by a legally effective judgment or decision of Court.

3. The statute of limitations is also counted continuously in cases where the enjoyment of civil rights and immunity from civil obligations is legally transferred to another person.
Bộ luật dân sự@154:
Start of the statute of limitations for initiating a civil lawsuit, the statute of limitations for requesting the resolution of a civil matter

1. The statute of limitations for initiating a civil lawsuit is counted from the date on which the person with the right to claim knows or must know that their lawful rights and interests have been infringed, unless otherwise provided for by law.

2. The statute of limitations for requesting settlement of a civil matter shall be counted from the date of arising of the right to request, except for cases otherwise provided by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@157:
Restarting the statute of limitations for initiating a civil case

1. The statute of limitations for initiating a civil lawsuit begins again in the following cases:

a) The obligor has admitted Part or all of its obligations towards the petitioner;

b) The obligor acknowledges or fulfills part of its obligations towards the plaintiff;

c) The parties have self-reconciling.

2. The statute of limitations for initiating a civil lawsuit begins again from the day following the date of occurrence of the event specified in Clause 1 of this Article.

Second part

 PROPERTY AND OTHER RIGHTS TO PROPERTY
Bộ luật dân sự@158:
Ownership

Ownership includes the right to possess, use and dispose of the property of the owner in accordance with the law.
Bộ luật dân sự@160:
Principles for establishing and exercising ownership and other rights to property

1. Ownership and other rights to property are established and exercised in the case of this Code, provided for by other relevant laws.

Other property-related rights are still valid in case the ownership rights are transferred, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or other relevant laws.

2. The owner may perform all acts of his own will with respect to the property but must not contravene the provisions of the law, cause damage or affect the national, ethnic or public interests. , the lawful rights and interests of others.

3. The holder of other property rights may perform all acts within the scope of the rights specified in this Code and other relevant laws but not may cause damage or affect the national interests, the people, the public interests, the lawful rights and interests of the property owner or other people.
Bộ luật dân sự@161:
Time of establishing ownership and other rights to property

1. Time of establishing ownership and other rights to property shall comply with the provisions of this Code and other laws. concerned; if there is no provision by law, the agreement of the parties shall apply; if not provided for by law and the parties do not agree, the time of establishing ownership rights and other rights to the property shall be the time when the property is transferred.

The time when the property is transferred is the time when the obligee or their legal representative takes possession of the property.

2. Where the property has not been transferred where yields arise, profits and profits shall belong to the party having the property transferred, unless otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@162:
To bear the risk of property

1. The owner must bear the risk of the property under his/her possession, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by this Code or other relevant laws. otherwise specified .

2. The holder of other rights to the property shall bear the risk of the property within the scope of his/her rights, unless otherwise agreed with the property owner or this Code or the law. other relevant regulations.
Bộ luật dân sự@163:
Protection of property rights and other rights to property

1. No one may be unlawfully restricted or deprived of any other property rights or rights.

2 Where it is absolutely necessary for reasons of national defense and security or in the national interest, in a state of emergency, or for natural disaster prevention and control, the State requisitions or requisitions with compensation the properties of organizations or individuals according to the provisions of law. market price.
Bộ luật dân sự@164:
Measures to protect property rights, other rights to property

1. Owners, other rights holders in property have the right to protect themselves, preventing any person from having acts of infringing upon their rights by means not contrary to the provisions of law.

2. Owners and other right-holders of property have the right to request courts or state agencies to have other authority to force the person infringing the right to return the property, stop the act of unlawfully obstructing the exercise of ownership rights and other property rights and demand compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@166:
Right to reclaim property

1. Owners, holders of other rights to property have the right to reclaim property from possessors, users of property, and beneficiaries of property. property has no legal basis.

2. The owner has no right to reclaim the property from the possession of the subject who has other rights to the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@167:
The right to reclaim movable property without registration of ownership from a bona fide possessor

The owner of the right to reclaim movable property does not have to register ownership from a bona fide possessor in the event In case the rightful possessor obtains this movable property through an uncompensated contract with a person who does not have the right to dispose of the property; in the case of a contract with compensation, the owner has the right to reclaim the movable property. if such movable property is stolen, lost or otherwise possessed against the will of the owner.
Bộ luật dân sự@168:
The right to claim movable property subject to registration or immovable property from a bona fide possessor

Owner entitled to claim of movable property must register title or immovable property from the occupier in good faith, except for the case specified in Clause 2, Article 133 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@169:
The right to request cessation of unlawful obstruction to the exercise of ownership rights and other property rights

When exercising ownership or other rights to property, the owner may have the right to request the person who commits an illegal act of obstruction to stop that act or have the right to request a court or other competent state agency to force such person to stop the violation.
Bộ luật dân sự@170:
The right to claim compensation for damage

The owner, the holder of other rights to the property has the right to demand compensation from the person infringing the ownership rights or other rights to the property. damages.
Bộ luật dân sự@171:
Rights and obligations of the owner and other rights holders to the property in the event of an emergency

1.
