An emergency situation is a person's situation because he wants to avoid a situation. the danger is actually directly threatening the public interest, the lawful rights and interests of oneself or another person and there is no other way but to take action to cause a damage smaller than the damage to be prevented.

2. In an urgent situation, the owner or the holder of other rights to the property must not obstruct others from using their property or prevent others from causing damage to such property in order to prevent . Owners and other rights holders with respect to damaged property in an urgent situation shall be entitled to compensation for damage according to the provisions of Article 595 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@172:
Obligation to protect the environment

When exercising ownership or other rights to property, the subject must comply with the provisions of the law on environmental protection; if it pollutes the environment, must stop polluting acts, take measures to remedy the consequences and pay compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@173:
Obligation to respect and ensure social order and safety

When exercising ownership rights and other rights to property, the subject must respect and ensure social order and safety. society, must not abuse their rights to cause social disorder and safety, cause damage to the national interests, the nation, the public interest, the legitimate rights and interests of others.
Bộ luật dân sự@174:
Obligation to respect construction rules

When building works, owners and other rights-holders of property must comply with the law on construction, ensure safety, not be built beyond the height and distance prescribed by the law on construction and must not infringe upon the lawful rights and interests of the owner and other holders of property rights that are adjacent and adjacent immovable property. around.
Bộ luật dân sự@175:
Boundary between real estate

1. The boundary between adjacent properties is determined by agreement or by decision of a competent state agency.

Boundary may also be determined by custom or by a boundary that has existed for 30 years or more without dispute.

Do not encroach, occupy, or change the boundary marker, even if the boundary is a canals, ditches, trenches, trenches, field banks All subjects have the obligation to respect and maintain common boundaries.

2. Land users are allowed to use space and the ground vertically from the boundary. of the land parcel in accordance with the provisions of the law and must not affect the use of the land by others.

Land users are only allowed to plant trees and do other things within the premises of the land under the use right. their own and according to the defined boundary; if the roots of a tree or branch exceed the boundary, they must trim the roots, cut or prune the excess, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@176:
Demarcation lines separating real estate

1. Property owners may only erect markers, fences, plant trees, and build walls on the land under their right to use.

2. Owners of adjacent real estate may agree with each other on erecting landmarks, fences, planting trees, and building partitions on the boundary to serve as boundary markers between the properties; this boundary marker is the common ownership of those subjects.

In case the boundary marker is created by only one party on the boundary and is agreed by the owner of the adjacent real estate, that boundary marker is common ownership, construction costs shall be borne by the creator, unless otherwise agreed; if the owner of the adjoining immovable property does not agree but has a valid reason, the owner has erected a landmark . , fences, planting trees, building partition walls must be removed.

3. For boundary markers which are common house walls, owners of adjacent real estate may not make windows, air vents or perforate walls to place them. construction structure, unless otherwise agreed by the owner of the adjacent property.

In case the house is built separately but the walls are adjacent to each other, the owner may only punch the wall and place the construction structure up to limit separating their walls.

For trees as a common boundary, both parties are obliged to protect; the yield obtained from the tree shall be divided equally, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@177:
Safety in case trees and structures are in danger of causing damage

1. In case trees and constructions are in danger of collapsing onto adjacent and surrounding properties The property owner shall immediately take remedial measures, cut down trees, repair or dismantle such construction at the request of the owner of adjacent and surrounding real estate or at the request of the agency. competent state agency; if not voluntarily, the owner of adjacent and surrounding real estate has the right to request a competent state agency to cut down trees or demolish trees. borne by the owners of trees and constructions.

2. When digging wells, digging ponds or constructing underground structures, the work owners must dig and build at a distance prescribed by law. construction law landmarks at a distance and in a reasonable location, must ensure hygiene, safety and do not affect other real estate owners.

3. In case of causing damage to owners of adjacent and surrounding real estate as prescribed in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, the owners of trees and works must compensate.
Bộ luật dân sự@178:
Open the door to the adjacent property

1. The owner of the house is only allowed to open the door, the window to the next house, the house opposite and the common road according to the provisions of the law. building code.

2. The underside of the roof over the door, the underside of the window roof facing the common road must be at least 2.5 meters above the ground.
Bộ luật dân sự@179:
Concept of possession

1. Possession is the subject's possession and control of property, directly or indirectly, as the holder of the right to the property.

2. Appropriation Ownership includes possession by the owner and possession by a person who is not the owner.

The possession of a person who is not the owner cannot be a basis for establishing ownership rights, except in the case specified by law. prescribed in Articles 228, 229, 230, 231, 232, 233 and 236 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@180:
In good faith

In good faith possession is possession in which the possessor has grounds to believe that he or she has a right to the property currently possessed.
Bộ luật dân sự@181:
Insincere possession

Indecent possession is possession that the possessor knows or ought to know that he or she has no right to the property being possessed.
Bộ luật dân sự@182:
Continuous possession

1. Continuous possession is possession exercised over a period of time without a dispute over the right to the property, or with dispute but not yet resolved. decided by a legally effective judgment or decision of a Court or other competent state agency, even when the property is assigned to another person to possess.

2. The possession is not continuous. shall not be considered as a basis for speculation about the status and rights of the possessor specified in Article 184 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@183:
Public Occupation

1. Public Occupancy is a possession that is carried out in a transparent manner, without concealment; the property being possessed is used according to its features, uses and the possessor preserves and preserves it as if it were his/her own property.

2. Non-public possession shall not be considered a basis for conjecture about the status and rights of the possessor specified in Article 184 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@184:
Speculation about the status and rights of the possessor

1. The possessor is presumed to be bona fide; anyone who claims that the possessor is dishonest must prove it.

2 . In case there is a dispute over the right to the property, the possessor is presumed to have that right.The person having a dispute with the possessor must prove that the possessor has no right.

3. The rightful, continuous and public possessor may apply the statute of limitations for enjoying rights and enjoy the yields and profits brought by the property in accordance with the provisions of this Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@185:
Protecting the possession

In case the possession is infringed by another person, the possessor has the right to request the infringing person to stop the act, restore the original state, return the property and pay compensation for damage or request a court or other competent state agency to force the person to stop the act, restore the original condition, return the property and pay compensation for the damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@186:
Owner's right of possession

Owner may perform all acts according to his will to hold and control his property but must not contravene the law or social morality .
Bộ luật dân sự@187:
The right of possession of the person authorized by the owner to manage the property

1. The person authorized by the owner to manage the property takes possession of the property to the extent, in a manner The time limit is determined by the owner.

2. The person authorized by the owner to manage the property cannot become the owner of the assigned property according to the provisions of Article 236 of this Code. .
Bộ luật dân sự@188:
The right of possession of the person assigned the property through a civil transaction

1. When the owner hands over the property to another person through a civil transaction, the content does not include the transfer of the right. property, the assignee must take possession of such property in accordance with the purposes and contents of the transaction.

2. The property assignee has the right to use the assigned or transferred property. the right to possess and use such property for another person with the consent of the owner.

3. The person assigned the property cannot become the owner of the assigned property according to the provisions of Article 236 of This Code.

Subsection 2

USERRRIGHTS
Bộ luật dân sự@189:
The right to use

Use right is the right to exploit the utility, to enjoy the benefits and profits from the property.

The right to use can be transferred to another person by agreement or by provisions of law.
Bộ luật dân sự@190:
Owner's right to use

The owner may use the property according to his or her will but must not cause damage or affect the national, ethnic, or public interests community, the lawful rights and interests of others.
Bộ luật dân sự@191:
Use rights of non-owners

Non-owners may use the property as agreed upon with the owner or as required by law.

Sub item 3

 DECISION
Bộ luật dân sự@192:
Disposal

Disposal is the right to transfer ownership of property, to renounce ownership, to consume, or to destroy property.
Bộ luật dân sự@193:
Conditions for exercising the right to dispose

The disposition of property must be performed by a person with civil act capacity and not contrary to the provisions of law.

Where it is provided by law. the order and procedures for property disposition must comply with such order and procedures.
Bộ luật dân sự@194:
Owner's Disposal

Owner has the right to sell, exchange, give, lend, inherit, give up ownership, consume, destroy or perform other forms of disposition in accordance with the provisions of law on property.
Bộ luật dân sự@195:
The right of disposition of a person other than the owner

The person who is not a property owner has the right to dispose of the property only as authorized by the owner or as required by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@196:
Restriction of the right to dispose

1. The right of disposition is restricted only in cases prescribed by law.

2. When the property to be sold is a property belonging to a historical-cultural relic. If an individual or legal entity has the right of priority to purchase certain assets in accordance with the provisions of the law, when selling the property according to the provisions of the Law on Cultural Heritage, the State has the right of priority to purchase. property, the owner must give priority to such subjects.
Bộ luật dân sự@197:
Properties owned by the entire people

Land, water resources, mineral resources, resources in sea and airspace, other natural resources and properties invested by the State Management is a public property owned by the entire people and managed by the State on behalf of the owner and uniformly managed.
Bộ luật dân sự@198:
Exercise the owner's rights to property owned by the entire people

1. The State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is the representative and exercise of the owner's rights to the property

1. property under the ownership of the whole people.

2. The Government uniformly manages and ensures the proper, efficient and economical use of property owned by the whole people.
Bộ luật dân sự@199:
Occupying, using, and disposing of property belonging to the entire people

The possession, use and disposition of property belonging to the entire people shall be carried out within the scope and in a free sequence. Legal provisions.
Bộ luật dân sự@200:
Exercise all-people ownership of assets invested in enterprises

1. When property owned by the entire people is invested in enterprises, the State exercises the rights of owners ownership of such property in accordance with the law on enterprises, management and use of state capital invested in production and business at the enterprise and other relevant laws.

2 Enterprises shall manage and use capital, land, natural resources and other assets invested by the State in accordance with relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@201:
Exercise all-people ownership of property assigned to state agencies or people's armed forces units

1. When property belonging to the entire people is assigned to state agencies, , the people's armed forces unit, the State exercises the right to inspect and supervise the management and use of such assets.

2. State agencies and units of the people's armed forces perform the management, use the property for the right purpose, according to the provisions of law, for the property assigned by the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@202:
Exercise the entire people's ownership rights over property assigned to political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations, and social organizations Society - occupation
1. When property owned by the entire people is assigned to a political organization, socio-political organization, socio-political-professional organization, social organization or social organization - For a profession, the State exercises the right to inspect and supervise the management and use of such property.

2. Political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political organizations - profession Enterprises, social organizations, socio-professional organizations shall manage and use properties assigned by the State for the right purposes, within the scope, in the manner and in the order provided by law, and in accordance with the provisions of law. functions and duties are specified in the charter.
Bộ luật dân sự@203:
Rights of individuals and legal entities to the use and exploitation of property owned by the entire people
Individuals and legal entities may use land, exploit aquatic resources, natural resources and other properties under the ownership of the entire people for the right purposes, effectively, and to fulfill obligations to the State in accordance with law.
Bộ luật dân sự@204:
Property owned by the whole people that has not been assigned to individuals or legal entities for management
For property owned by the whole people that has not yet been assigned to individuals or legal entities for management, the Government shall organize carry out the protection, investigation, survey and planning to put into operation.

Subsection 2
PRIVATE
Bộ luật dân sự@205:
Private property and privately owned property
1. Private property is the property of an individual or a legal entity.

2. Legal property under private ownership is unrestricted. in quantity, value.
Bộ luật dân sự@206:
Occupy, use and dispose of privately owned property
1. The owner has the right to possess, use and dispose of privately owned property to serve the needs of daily life and consumption. use, production, business and other purposes are not illegal.

2. The possession, use and disposition of privately owned property must not cause damage or affect the national interests. family, ethnicity, public interest, and lawful rights and interests of others.

Subsection 3
COMMON PROPERTY
Bộ luật dân sự@207:
Common property and types of common ownership
1. Joint ownership is the ownership of property by more than one person.

2. Joint ownership includes joint ownership by share and ownership. unified.
Bộ luật dân sự@208:
Establishment of common ownership

Common ownership is established by agreement, by law or by custom.
Bộ luật dân sự@209:
Party ownership

1. Shared ownership is joint ownership in which each owner's share of ownership is determined to the common property.

2. Each joint owner in part has rights and obligations over the property under common ownership in proportion to his or her share of ownership rights, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@210:
Consolidated common ownership

1. Consolidated common ownership is joint ownership in which the share of ownership by each joint owner is not determined over the common property.
 
Consolidated common ownership includes divisible joint ownership and undivided joint ownership.

2. Consolidated joint owners have equal rights and obligations to the property. jointly owned.
Bộ luật dân sự@211:
Common property of the community

1. Common property of the community is the property of the family line, hamlet, hamlet, hamlet, village, hamlet, phum, squirrel, religious community and community. other residents with respect to property formed according to custom, property jointly contributed, donated, donated by members of the community or from other sources in accordance with the provisions of law for the purpose of the purpose of satisfying the legitimate common interests of the community.

2. Members of the community jointly manage, use and dispose of common property as agreed or customary for the common benefit of the community but must not violate the prohibition of the law, not contrary to social morality.

3. The common property of the community is the undivided common property.
Bộ luật dân sự@212:
Common property of family members

1. Property of family members living together includes property contributed by members, jointly created and other properties ownership rights may be established according to the provisions of this Code and other relevant laws.

2. The possession, use and disposition of common property by family members shall be done in accordance with the method of agreement. In case of disposing of property being real property, registered movable property, or property being the main source of the family's income, the consent of all family members who are capable adults must be obtained. full civil act, unless otherwise provided for by law.

If there is no agreement, the provisions on joint ownership according to the part prescribed in this Code and other relevant laws, shall apply. except for the case specified in Article 213 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@213:
Common property of husband and wife

1. Common property of husband and wife is divisible common property.

2. Husband and wife jointly create and develop property. husband and wife have equal rights to possess, use and dispose of common property.

3. Husband and wife agree or authorize each other to possess, use and dispose of common property.

4 The common property of husband and wife may be divided by agreement or by decision of the Court.

5. In case the husband and wife choose the property regime as agreed in accordance with the law on marriage and family, the common property of husband and wife shall be applied according to this property regime.
Bộ luật dân sự@214:
Common ownership in the apartment building

1. The area, equipment and other assets shared in the apartment building in accordance with the Law on Housing are jointly owned by all of them. both owners of the apartments in that house and undivided, unless otherwise provided by law or otherwise agreed by all owners.

2. Owners of apartments in the condominium have equal rights and obligations in the management and use of the property specified in Clause 1 of this Article, unless otherwise provided for by law or otherwise agreed.

3. In case the apartment building is destroyed, canceled, the apartment owner's rights shall comply with the provisions of law.
Bộ luật dân sự@215:
Mixed common ownership

1. Mixed common ownership is ownership of assets contributed as capital by owners of different economic sectors for production and business purposes. profits.

2. Assets formed from capital contributed by owners, lawful profits earned from production and business activities or from other sources in accordance with the provisions of law are assets. property under mixed common ownership.

3. The possession, use and disposition of property under mixed common ownership must comply with the provisions of Article 209 of this Code and relevant laws. related to capital contribution, organization, production and business activities, management and administration, responsibility for assets and distribution of profits.
Bộ luật dân sự@216:
Common property management

Common owners jointly manage common property on the principle of consensus, unless otherwise agreed upon or otherwise provided by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@217:
Using the common property

1. Each joint owner in part has the right to exploit the utility, enjoy the benefits and profits from the common property in proportion to his or her share of ownership, except unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law.

2. Consolidated common owners have equal rights in exploiting the utility, enjoying yields and profits from the common property, except for otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@218:
Disposal of the common property

1. Each joint owner in part has the right to dispose of his share of the ownership rights.

2. The disposition of the consolidated common property shall be made in accordance with the law. agreement of the common owners or as prescribed by law.

3. In case a common owner sells part of his/her ownership rights, the other common owner has the right of priority to buy.

Within 03 months for common property being immovable property, 01 month for common property being movable, from the date on which other common owners receive notice of the sale and the conditions for sale. If there is no common owner to buy, then that owner is entitled to sell to another. The notice must be in writing and the conditions of sale to the other common owner must be the same as the conditions of sale to a non-common owner. must be the common owner.

In case of sale of a part of ownership, there is a violation of the right of priority to purchase, within 3 months from the date of detecting the violation of the right of priority to purchase, the owner must be the joint owner. joint ownership in part among the joint owners has the right to request the Court to transfer to itself the rights and obligations of the buyer; the party at fault causing damage must compensate for the damage.

4. Where one of the joint owners of the immovable property gives up his share of the ownership right or when this person dies without an heir, that share of ownership right belongs to the State, except in the case of joint ownership. of the community is jointly owned by the remaining common owners.

5. Where one of the joint owners of movable property gives up his share of the ownership right or when this person dies without an heir, that part of the ownership right shall be jointly owned by the remaining owners. 

6. Where all owners give up their ownership rights to the common property, the establishment of ownership rights shall comply with the provisions of Article 228 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@219:
Dividing property under common ownership

1. In case of divisible common ownership, each joint owner has the right to claim the division of common property; if the status of common ownership is to be maintained for a period of time as agreed by the common owners or as provided for by law, each joint owner has the right to claim the division of the common property only upon the expiration of such period; when the common property cannot be divided In kind, the joint owner who makes a request for division has the right to sell his/her share of the ownership rights, unless otherwise agreed by the joint owners.

2. In case someone requests one of them. If the joint owners perform the payment obligation and such joint owner has no separate property or the separate property is not sufficient for payment, the claimant has the right to request the division of the common property and participate in the division of the property. common property, unless otherwise provided for by law.

If it is not possible to divide the ownership right in kind or this division is opposed by the remaining joint owners, the obligee has the right to request the obligated to sell part of its ownership in order to fulfill its payment obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@222:
Establish ownership of assets obtained from labor, legal production and business activities, and creation of objects of intellectual property rights

Employees, persons conduct lawful production and business activities with ownership rights to property obtained from lawful labor, production and business activities, from the time of acquiring such property. Creative activities have ownership rights to assets obtained from creative activities according to the provisions of the Intellectual Property Law.
Bộ luật dân sự@223:
Essence of ownership under contract

The person assigned the property through a contract of sale, gift, exchange, loan or other contract of ownership transfer in accordance with the law have the right to own the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@224:
Establish ownership of yields and profits

Property owners and users have ownership rights to yields and profits as agreed or prescribed by law , from the time of receipt of such yield or profit.
Bộ luật dân sự@226:
Establish ownership in case of mixing

1. In case the assets of many different owners are mixed together to form a new indivisible object, the new object is the property of jointly owned by such owners, from the time of mixing.

2. When a person has mixed another's property into his own, even though he knew or ought to have known the property. own property and without the consent of the owner of the mixed property, the owner of the mixed property has one of the following rights:

a) Request the person who mixed the property to hand over the property new property for himself and to pay the person who mixed the value of his or her property;

b) Ask the person who mixed the property to pay the value of his share of the property and pay damages if not get new property.
Bộ luật dân sự@227:
Establish ownership in case of processing

1. The owner of the material being processed into a new object is the owner of the newly created object.

2 The user who uses raw materials owned by others for processing but in good faith becomes the owner of the new property but must pay the value of the raw materials and compensate the owner for the damage. .

3. In case the processor is not in good faith, the owner of the raw materials has the right to request the return of the new item; if there are more than one owner of the material, these people are co-owners according to the part. for newly-formed objects, corresponding to the value of each person's raw materials. The owner of raw materials processed in bad faith has the right to request the processor to compensate for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@228:
Establish ownership of derelict property, property of unknown owner

1. Derelict property is property to which the owner has renounced ownership of the property

1. Such property.

The person who has discovered or is managing the derelict property which is movable property shall have the right to own such property, unless otherwise provided for by law; if the property is immovable property, it shall belong to such property. to the State.

2. The person who discovers property that cannot be identified as the owner must notify or hand it over to the commune-level People's Committee or the nearest commune-level police station for public notice. The owner knows and receives it.

The handover must be recorded in writing, clearly stating the full name and address of the deliverer, recipient, condition, quantity, and volume of the property handed over. .

Commune-level People's Committee or commune-level police station that has received the property must notify the discoverer of the result of identification of the owner.

After one year from the date of public announcement, If it is not possible to determine who the owner of the movable property is, the ownership right to such movable property belongs to the person who discovered the property.

After 5 years from the date of public announcement, it cannot be determined. whoever is the owner of the property being real estate, that real estate belongs to the State; the discoverer is entitled to a reward in accordance with the law.
Bộ luật dân sự@229:
Establish ownership of buried, hidden, buried, sunken property found

1. The person who discovered the buried, hidden, buried, sunken property must have to notify or immediately return it to the owner; if it is not known who the owner is, it must notify or hand it over to the commune-level People's Committee or the nearest commune-level police station or other competent state agency. in accordance with the law.

2. Buried, hidden, buried, sunken property is found without or without identifying who the owner is, after deducting search costs, preservation, ownership rights to this property are determined as follows:

a) Property found to be property belonging to historical-cultural relics according to the provisions of the Law on Cultural Heritage belongs to The State; the person who finds the property is entitled to a reward in accordance with the law;

b) The found property is not a property belonging to a historical-cultural relic as prescribed by the Law. cultural heritage whose value is less than or equal to ten times the base salary prescribed by the State shall belong to the finder; if the property found has a value greater than ten times the base salary prescribed by the State, the finder is entitled to a value equal to ten times the base salary prescribed by the State and 50% of the value of the excess. ten times the base salary prescribed by the State, the remaining value belongs to the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@230:
Establish ownership of property dropped or forgotten by others

1. The person who discovers the property dropped or forgotten by another person knows the address of the person who dropped it or If they forget, they must notify or return the property to that person. publicly notify the owner and receive it back.

The commune-level People's Committee or commune-level police station that has received the property must notify the handover of the result of identifying the owner.
 
2. After 01 year from the date of public announcement of the property dropped or neglected by other people, if the owner cannot be identified or the owner does not come to receive it, the ownership rights to this property shall be vested. determined as follows::

a) In case the property is dropped or neglected with a value less than or equal to ten times the base salary prescribed by the State, the person who finds it shall establish ownership of the property. such property in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws; In case the property has a value greater than ten times the base salary prescribed by the State, after deducting maintenance costs, the person who finds it will enjoy a value equal to ten times the base salary prescribed by the State and 50 times the base salary prescribed by the State. % of the value of the portion exceeding ten times the base salary prescribed by the State, the remaining value belongs to the State;

b) In case the property is dropped or forgotten, it is the property of the inheritance. historical-cultural property according to the provisions of the Law on Cultural Heritage, such property belongs to the State; the person who picks up the property is entitled to a bonus in accordance with the law.
Bộ luật dân sự@231:
Establish ownership of lost livestock

1. The person who catches the lost cattle must keep it and immediately notify the People's Committee of the commune where he/she resides for notification. After 6 months from the date of public announcement or after 1 year for cattle roaming according to custom, the ownership rights to the cattle and the number of livestock born generated during the keeping period belongs to the person who caught the cattle.

2. In case the owner is entitled to receive the lost cattle back, he/she must pay the keeping wages and other expenses to the person who caught the cattle. During the time of keeping the lost livestock, if the livestock gives birth, the person who caught the cattle is entitled to half of the livestock born or 50% of the value of the livestock born and must compensate for the damage. if there is a fault in intentionally killing livestock.
Bộ luật dân sự@232:
Establish ownership of lost poultry

1. In case one person's poultry is lost and caught by another person, the catcher must publicly notify the owner to After 1 month from the date of public announcement, if no one comes to receive the poultry, the ownership rights to the poultry and the yield produced by the poultry during the keeping period belongs to the catcher. poultry.

2. In case the owner gets back the lost poultry, he/she must pay the keeping wages and other expenses to the person who caught the poultry. , the person who catches the poultry is entitled to the fruit produced by the poultry and must compensate for the damage if there is an intentional fault in causing the death of the poultry.
Bộ luật dân sự@233:
Establish ownership of aquatic animals

When one person's aquatic animals move naturally into another's fields, ponds, or lakes, they are owned by the person owns the fields or ponds. If an aquatic animal has a distinctive sign that can be identified as an animal that is not under his/her ownership, the person who owns such field, pond or lake must make a public announcement so that the owner can know and receive it back. . After 1 month from the date of public announcement, if no one comes to receive, the ownership rights to such aquatic animals belong to the person who owns the fields, ponds or lakes.
Bộ luật dân sự@234:
Establishment of ownership by inheritance

The heir may establish ownership of the inherited property in accordance with the provisions of Part Four of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@235:
Essence of ownership rights according to judgments or decisions of courts or other competent state agencies

Ownership rights can be established based on effective judgments and decisions laws of courts and other competent state agencies.
Bộ luật dân sự@236:
Establishment of property rights according to the statute of limitations due to possessing and benefiting from property without a legal basis

The possessor, the person who benefits from the property has no legal basis but in good faith. , continuously and publicly for a period of 10 years in the case of movables and 30 years in the case of immovable property, the owner shall become the owner of such property from the time of commencement of possession, except for the case of this Code and the law . other relevant provisions.

Subsection 2
TERMINATION OF PROPERTY RIGHTS
Bộ luật dân sự@238:
The owner transfers his/her ownership rights to another person

When the owner transfers his/her ownership right to another person through a contract of sale, exchange, donation, loan , other ownership transfer contracts as prescribed by law or through inheritance, the ownership rights to the property of that person shall terminate from the time the transferee's ownership rights arise.
Bộ luật dân sự@239:
Relinquishment of ownership
Owners may terminate their own ownership of their property by making a public statement or performing acts that demonstrate their relinquishment, use, use and dispose of such property.

For property where the abandonment of such property may harm social order and safety, or environmental pollution, the renunciation of ownership rights must comply with regulations provisions of the law.
Bộ luật dân sự@240:
Property that has been established for other people
Property of unknown owner; buried, hidden, buried, sunken property found; lost property , being neglected; livestock and poultry that are lost; aquatic animals that move naturally and have their ownership rights established for other people according to the provisions of Articles 228 to 233 of this Code. Ownership of those who have such property ceases.

When the ownership rights of the possessor or beneficiary of the property have been established according to the provisions of Article 236 of this Code or other provisions of law involved, the ownership rights of the person whose property is possessed shall be terminated.
Bộ luật dân sự@241:
Disposal of property to fulfill the owner's obligations
1. Ownership of an asset terminates when such property is disposed of to perform the owner's obligations under the decision by a Court or other competent state agency, unless otherwise provided for by law .

2. The handling of property to fulfill the owner's obligations does not apply to property that is not part of the property. distraint in accordance with the law.

3. Ownership of the property handled to perform the owner's obligations terminates at the time when the ownership rights of the recipient of such property arise. .

4. The handling of land use rights shall comply with the provisions of the land law.
Bộ luật dân sự@242:
Property is consumed or destroyed
When property is consumed or destroyed, ownership over that property ceases.
Bộ luật dân sự@243:
Property forfeited
In case the State expropriates the property according to the provisions of law, the ownership rights to that owner's property shall terminate from the time of decision of the state agency. competent to have legal effect.
Bộ luật dân sự@244:
Property forfeited
When the owner's property is confiscated or confiscated due to a crime or administrative violation, the ownership of such property shall terminate from the time legally effective judgments or decisions of courts or other competent state agencies.
Bộ luật dân sự@245:
Right to adjoining immovable property
Right to adjoining immovable property is a right to be exercised on an immovable property (referred to as the entitled immovable property) for the purpose of exploiting a other immovable property owned by another person (referred to as entitled immovable property).
Bộ luật dân sự@246:
Basis for establishing rights to adjoining immovable property
Rights to adjoining immovable property are established due to the natural terrain, as prescribed by law, by agreement or by will.
Bộ luật dân sự@247:
Effect of the right to adjoining immovable property
The right to adjoining immovable property is valid for all individuals and legal entities and is transferred when the immovable property is transferred, except for the other relevant provisions of the law.
Bộ luật dân sự@249:
Change in the exercise of the right to adjoining immovable property
In case there is a change in the use and exploitation of the entitled immovable property resulting in a change in the exercise of the right to the immovable property entitled to, the owner of the entitled immovable property must give advance notice to the entitled owner within a reasonable period of time. property owners are entitled to be consistent with this change.
Bộ luật dân sự@250:
Owner's obligation to drain rainwater

Owners of houses and other constructions must install water pipes so that rainwater from their roofs or constructions does not flows down to the property of the owner of the adjoining immovable property.
Bộ luật dân sự@251:
Owner's obligation in wastewater drainage

Owners of houses and other constructions must build underground drains or drainage ditches to bring wastewater to a specified place, so that the wastewater discharges does not spill over to the owner's property adjacent to the property, to a public street or to a public place.
Bộ luật dân sự@252:
Right to water supply and drainage through adjoining immovable property

In case due to the natural location of the immovable property, the water supply and drainage must pass through another immovable property, the owner of the property shall The movable property with water flowing through must have an appropriate water supply and drainage outlet, must not obstruct or block the flow of water.

The user of the water supply and drainage must minimize damage to the owner to a minimum. Owners of real estate have water running through when installing water pipes; if causing damage, they must compensate. If there is water flowing through, the users of the water supply and drainage channels do not have to pay compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@253:
The right to water and drain water in cultivation

The person who has the right to use the arable land when there is a need for watering and draining water, has the right to request the surrounding land users to let own a suitable and convenient water route for irrigation and drainage; the requested person is obliged to meet such requirement; if the user of the water channel causes damage to the surrounding land user, he/she must compensate .
Bộ luật dân sự@254:
Right of way through

1. An owner whose property is surrounded by other owners' properties without or with insufficient access to a public road, may the right to require the owner of the enclosed property to reserve for himself a reasonable passage on their portion of the land.

The passage is opened on which adjoining property is deemed most convenient and reasonable, taking into account the specifics of the site, the benefit of the property being fenced off and the damage caused is minimal to the walkable property.

The owner of the property enjoys the right of way Passing through must compensate the owner of the entitled immovable property, unless otherwise agreed.

2. The location, length, width, and height limits of the passage shall be agreed upon by the parties. . In case real estate is divided into several parts for different owners or users, when dividing, the necessary passages must be reserved for the people inside as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article without compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@255:
Electricity transmission lines, communication via other real estate

Property owners have the right to connect power lines, communication via the property of the owners reasonably, but must ensure the safety and convenience of such owners; if causing damage, they must pay compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@257:
Utilization right

Utilising right is the right of the subject to exploit the utility and enjoy the yields and profits on the property under the ownership of another subject for a certain period of time.
Bộ luật dân sự@258:
The basis for establishing the usufruct right

The usufruct right is established according to the provisions of law, agreement or will.
Bộ luật dân sự@259:
Effectiveness of the usufruct right

The usufruct right is established from the time of receipt of the transfer of property, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by relevant law.

Entitlement The application has been established and takes effect for all individuals and legal entities, unless otherwise provided for by relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@260:
Term of usufruct

1. The term of usufruct is agreed upon by the parties or prescribed by law, but up to the end of the life of the first usufructee if the usufructuary is individual and until the juridical person ceases to exist but up to 30 years if the first beneficiary is a juridical person.

2. The beneficiary has the right to lease out the usufruct right for the period specified in Clause 1 of Article This.
Bộ luật dân sự@261:
Rights of the usufructuary

1. By themselves or by allowing others to exploit, use, collect profits and profits from the subject matter of the usufruct right.

2. Request the owner property owners perform the obligation to repair the property as prescribed in Clause 4, Article 263 of this Code; in case of performing the obligation on behalf of the property owner, they have the right to request the property owner to reimburse expenses.

3. Lease usufruct right to the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@262:
Obligation of the beneficiary

1. Receive the property in its current state and register it if required by law.

2. Exploit the property in accordance with its uses and purposes the intended use of the property.

3. To keep and preserve the property as if it were one's own.

4. Periodically maintain and repair the property to ensure its normal use; restore the condition of the property and remedy the bad consequences for the property due to the failure to perform its obligations properly in accordance with the technical requirements or according to the customary preservation of the property.

5. Return the property to the owner at the end of the useful life.
Bộ luật dân sự@263:
Rights and obligations of the property owner

1. Dispose of the property but must not change the established usufruct right.

2. Request the Court to disqualify the enjoyment of the property. used in case the beneficiary seriously violates his/her obligations.

3. Not to obstruct or perform other acts that cause difficulties or infringe upon the legitimate rights and interests of the beneficiary.

4. Perform the obligation to repair the property to ensure that there is no significant deterioration leading to the property becoming unusable or losing the entire utility and value of the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@264:
The right to enjoy yields and profits

1. The beneficial owner has title to the yields or profits derived from the property which is the subject of the usufruct right during the period in which this right is in effect. force.

2. In case the usufruct right terminates without the maturity of the yield or income, the beneficiary shall enjoy the value of the yield or income upon the maturity of the yield or income. obtained in proportion to the period in which the person is entitled to enjoy it.
Bộ luật dân sự@266:
Return of property upon termination of usufruct

Property subject to usufruct right must be returned to the owner upon termination of usufruct, unless otherwise agreed or The law provides otherwise.
Bộ luật dân sự@267:
Surface rights

Surface rights are the rights of a subject to the land, water surface, space above the ground, water surface and subsoil to which such land use right belongs to the subject. other.
Bộ luật dân sự@268:
Basis for establishing surface rights

Surface rights are established by law, by agreement or by will.
Bộ luật dân sự@269:
Effectiveness of surface rights

Surface rights take effect from the time the holder of land use rights transfers the ground, water surface, space above ground, water surface and subsoil to the holder of the surface right, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by the relevant law.

The surface right is valid for all individuals and legal entities, unless otherwise provided for by the relevant law. otherwise.
Bộ luật dân sự@270:
Term of surface right

1. The term of surface right is determined by law, agreement or will but not exceeding the term of land use right.

2. In case the agreement or will does not specify the term of the surface right, each party has the right to terminate this right at any time but must notify the other party in writing at least 06 months in advance. .
Bộ luật dân sự@271:
Content of surface rights

1. The holders of surface rights have the right to exploit and use the ground, water surface, space above ground, water surface and underground under the use right. other people's land for construction, planting, or cultivation, but must not contravene the provisions of this Code, the law on land, construction, planning, natural resources, minerals and other provisions of law. relevant law.

2. The surface right holder has the right to ownership of the property created under the provisions of clause 1 of this Article.

3. Where the surface right is partially transferred or in its entirety, the transferee inherits the surface right on the condition and to the extent corresponding to the part of the surface right transferred.
Bộ luật dân sự@273:
Dispose of property when surface rights terminate

1. When surface rights terminate, the holders of surface rights must return the land, water surface, space above ground, water surface and subsoil to holders of land use rights as agreed or required by law.

2. Surface rights holders must dispose of their property before the termination of the surface rights, unless otherwise agreed.

If the owner of the surface right does not handle the property before the termination of the surface right, the ownership of such property belongs to the holder of the land use right from the time surface rights terminates, unless the land use right holder does not receive such property.

In case the land use right holder does not receive the property but must dispose of the property, the holder of the land use right face to pay the cost of handling the property.

Third part
OBLIGATIONS AND CONTRACT
Bộ luật dân sự@274:
Obligation

Obligation is an act whereby one or more subjects (hereinafter referred to as obligor) must deliver things, transfer rights, pay money or valuable papers. , perform work or not perform certain work for the benefit of one or more other entities (hereinafter referred to as the obligee).
Bộ luật dân sự@276:
Object of obligation

1. Object of obligation is property, work to be done or not done.

2. Subject of obligation must be defined.
Bộ luật dân sự@277:
Place of performance of obligations

1. Location of performance of obligations shall be agreed upon by the parties.

2. In the absence of agreement, the place of performance of obligations shall be determined as follows. following:

a) The place of immovable property, if the subject matter of the obligation is immovable property;

b) The place of residence or domicile of the obligee, if the subject matter of the obligation is not any movable property.

When the obligee changes domicile or domicile, it must notify the obligee and bear the increased costs resulting from the change of domicile or domicile, unless otherwise agreed. other.
Bộ luật dân sự@278:
Term for performance of obligations

1. The time limit for performance of obligations shall be agreed upon by the parties, as prescribed by law or under a decision of a competent authority.

2. The obligor must perform the obligation on time, unless otherwise provided by this Code or other relevant laws.

In case the obligor has voluntarily performed the obligation ahead of time and the obligee has the right to accept the performance of an obligation, the obligation shall be deemed to have been completed on time.

3. If the time limit for performance of the obligation cannot be determined as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, each Party may perform or demand performance at any time, but must notify the other party in advance a reasonable time.
Bộ luật dân sự@279:
Performance of the obligation to deliver the object

1. The party obligated to deliver the object must preserve and preserve the object until it is delivered.

2. When the object to be delivered is a specific object, the party shall obliged to deliver the same object and in the right condition as committed; if it is an object of the same type, it must deliver the same quantity and quality as agreed upon; if there is no agreement on quality, it must deliver the object with the same quality. average quantity; if it is a synchronous object, it must be delivered synchronously.

3. The obligor shall bear all costs for the delivery of the object, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@280:
Performance of the payment obligation

1. The payment obligation must be performed in full, on time, at the agreed place and method.

2. The payment obligation including interest on the principal, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@281:
Obligation to perform or not to perform a work

1. Obligation to perform an act is an obligation under which the obligor is required to properly perform it.

2. An obligation not to perform an act is an obligation under which the obligor must not perform that act.
Bộ luật dân sự@282:
Performance of obligations periodically

Obligations are performed periodically as agreed upon, prescribed by law or decided by a competent authority.

Delay in performance. Periodical obligations are also considered as late performance.
Bộ luật dân sự@283:
Performance of obligations through a third party

With the consent of the obligee, the obligor may authorize a third party to perform the obligation on his behalf, but shall still be responsible for obligee, if the third party fails to perform or improperly performs the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@284:
Conditional performance of obligations

1. If the parties have an agreement or the law provides for the conditions for performance of the obligation, when such conditions arise, the obligor must perform present.

2. If the condition does not occur or occurs due to the influence of one party, the provisions of Clause 2, Article 120 of this Code shall apply.
Bộ luật dân sự@285:
Performance of an obligation with an arbitrary object

1. An obligation with an arbitrarily selected object is an obligation whose subject matter is one of many different assets or affairs and the obligee The obligee may choose at its discretion, unless there is an agreement or the law provides for the right of choice to the obligee.

2. The obligee must notify the obligee of the In case the obligee has determined the time limit for performance of the selected obligation, the obligee must complete it on time.

3. property or an act, the obligor must deliver the property or perform the act.
Bộ luật dân sự@286:
Performance of a replaceable obligation

Replaceable obligation is an obligation in which the obligor fails to perform the original obligation, it can perform another obligation already approved by the obligee accepted to replace that obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@287:
Performing a separate obligation

When many people perform an obligation, but each has a certain and separate part of the obligation, each person must only perform his or her part of the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@288:
Performance of a joint obligation

1. A joint obligation is an obligation that is jointly performed by many persons and the obligee may require any of the obligors to perform perform the entire obligation.

2. Where a person has performed the entire obligation, he/she has the right to request other joint obligors to perform their part of the joint obligation towards him/her.

3. Where the obligee has appointed one of the joint obligors to perform the entire obligation, but later exempts that person, the remaining persons are also exempt from performing the obligation. 

4. In case the obligee only exempts one of the joint obligors from performing his/her part of the obligation, the remaining parties must still jointly perform their part of the obligation. their service.
Bộ luật dân sự@289:
Performance of an obligation towards many obligees

1. An obligation against many obligees is an obligation under which each of the obligees can claim requires the obligor to perform the entire obligation.

2. The obligor may perform its obligation to any of the related parties.

3. Case if one of the persons with joint rights exempts the obligor from performing its part of the obligation, the obligor must still perform the remaining part of the obligation towards the other obligors.
Bộ luật dân sự@290:
Performing an obligation divisible in parts

1. A divisible obligation is an obligation that the subject matter of which can be divided into parts for performance.

2 . The obligor may partially perform the obligation, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@291:
Performance of an indivisible obligation

1. An indivisible obligation is an obligation where the subject matter of the obligation must be performed at the same time.

2. In case many people have to perform an indivisible obligation at the same time, they must perform the obligation at the same time.
Bộ luật dân sự@293:
Scope of the obligation to be secured

1. An obligation may be partially or fully secured as agreed upon or prescribed by law; otherwise, there is no agreement and the law does not provide for it. If the scope of security is determined, the obligation is deemed to be fully secured, including the obligation to pay interest, fines and compensation.

2. A secured obligation may be a present obligation, a future obligation or conditional obligation.

3. In case of security of a future obligation, an obligation formed within the security period is a secured obligation, unless otherwise agreed. .
Bộ luật dân sự@294:
Security for performance of future obligations

1. In case of security for performance of future obligations, the parties have the right to agree specifically on the scope of the secured obligation and the duration performance of a secured obligation, unless otherwise provided for by law.

2. When a future obligation is formed, the parties are not required to re-establish a security measure for that obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@295:
Security property

1. Security property must be owned by the guarantor, except for the case of holding the property, retaining ownership.

2. Security can be described in general, but must be identifiable.

3. Collateral can be existing or future assets.

4. Value of collateral The guarantee may be greater than, equal to or less than the value of the secured obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@296:
An asset used to secure the performance of multiple obligations

1. An asset can be used to secure the performance of multiple obligations, if valid at the time of establishment of the security transaction. security is greater than the total value of the secured obligations, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law.

2. Where a property is secured for the performance of many obligations, the securing party must notify the following secured party of the fact that the security property is being used to secure the performance of other obligations.Each security must be made in writing.

3. In case the assets must be handled property to perform a due obligation, the other obligations, though not yet due, are considered to be due and all the jointly secured parties are entitled to participate in the disposal of the property. the disposal of property shall be responsible for the disposal of the property, unless otherwise agreed by the parties to the security.

In case the parties wish to continue to perform their undue obligations, they may agree on the use of other assets by the guarantor to secure the performance of undue obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@297:
Validity against a third party

1. A security comes into effect against a third party from the time the security is registered or the security receiver holds or occupies security property.

2. When the security measure becomes effective against a third party, the secured party is entitled to recourse to the security property and is entitled to payment as prescribed in Article 308 of this Law. This Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@298:
Registration of security interest

1. Security interest is registered under agreement or in accordance with law.

Registration is a condition for the security transaction to take effect. only in cases where it is required by law.

2. In case of registration, the security interest becomes effective against a third party from the time of registration.

3. Registration of the security measure security interests shall comply with the provisions of the law on registration of security interests.
Bộ luật dân sự@299:
Case of handling collateral

1. Due to the due date for performance of the secured obligation, the obligor fails to perform or improperly performs the obligation.

2. is obliged to perform the secured obligation ahead of time due to a breach of the obligation as agreed upon or prescribed by law.

3. In other cases as agreed upon by the parties or provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@300:
Notice of the disposal of the collateral

1. Before disposing of the security, the secured party must give written notice within a reasonable time of the disposition of the security. collateral for the guarantor and other jointly secured parties.

For the security property that is in danger of being damaged leading to a decrease in value or total loss of value, the secured party may right of immediate disposition, and at the same time, must notify the securing party and other secured parties about the disposal of such property.

2. In case the secured party fails to notify the disposal of the secured property. If the security specified in Clause 1 of this Article causes damage, it must compensate the securing party and other jointly secured parties.
Bộ luật dân sự@301:
Delivering the security property for disposal

The person holding the security property is obliged to hand over the security property to the secured party for handling when falling into one of the cases specified in Article 2 of this Law. 299 of this Code.

If the property holder fails to deliver the property, the secured party has the right to request the court to settle it, unless otherwise provided for by relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@302:
The right to receive back the security property

Before the time of disposal of the security property, the securing party fully fulfills its obligations towards the secured party and pays the costs incurred by If the performance of an obligation is delayed, he/she shall have the right to receive such property, unless otherwise provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@304:
Selling mortgaged or mortgaged properties

1. The auction of mortgaged or mortgaged properties shall comply with the law on asset auction.

2. The self-sale of the pledged or mortgaged property by the secured party shall comply with the provisions on property sale in this Code and the following provisions:

a) The payment of the proceeds from the settlement property management shall comply with the provisions of Article 307 of this Code;

b) After the result of the sale of the property, the property owner and the party with the right to dispose of the property must carry out the following procedures. in accordance with the law to transfer property ownership to the property purchaser.
Bộ luật dân sự@305:
Receive the security property itself to replace the performance of obligations by the securing party

1. The secured party is entitled to receive the security property itself to replace the performance of obligations of the guarantor if there is an agreement when establishing the security transaction.

2. If there is no agreement as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the secured party may only receive the security property itself for replacement. substitute for the performance of the obligation when the guarantor agrees in writing.

3. In case the value of the collateral is greater than the value of the secured obligation, the secured party must pay the amount such difference to the securing party; in case the value of the collateral is smaller than the value of the secured obligation, the unpaid portion of the obligation becomes an unsecured obligation.

4. the security is obliged to carry out the procedures for transferring the ownership of the property to the secured party in accordance with the provisions of law.
Bộ luật dân sự@306:
Valuation of the security asset

1. The guarantor and the secured party have the right to agree on the price of the security asset or determine it through an asset valuation organization when handling the property security.

If there is no agreement, the property shall be valued through an asset valuation organization.

2. The valuation of the security asset must be objective and consistent with the market price. market.

3. The valuation organization must compensate for damage if it commits illegal acts that cause damage to the guarantor or the secured party in the course of valuing the security asset.
Bộ luật dân sự@307:
Payment of the amount obtained from the disposal of the pledged or mortgaged property

1. The amount obtained from the disposal of the pledged or mortgaged property after payment of maintenance costs . , mortgage after paying the cost of preservation, seizure and handling of the pledged or mortgaged property is larger than the value of the secured obligation, the difference must be paid to the guarantor.

3 If the amount of money obtained from the handling of the pledged or mortgaged property after payment of expenses for preservation, seizure and handling of the pledged or mortgaged property is smaller than the value of the secured obligation, the An unpaid obligation is defined as an unsecured obligation, unless the parties agree to supplement the security property.The secured party has the right to require the secured obligor to perform. unpaid portion of the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@308:
The order of priority for payment between the parties jointly receiving the security property

1. When an asset is used to secure the performance of many obligations, the order of priority for payment between the parties shall be the same. the receipt of security is determined as follows:

a) Where the security measures are effective against a third party, the order of payment shall be determined according to the order in which the countervailing effect is established; 

b) In case there is a security measure that becomes effective against a third party and there is a security measure that does not take effect against a third party, the obligation to have a security measure is effective. against a third party is paid first;

c) In case the security measures are not effective against the third party, the order of payment shall be determined according to the order in which the measure is established. security.

2. The order of priority for payment specified in Clause 1 of this Article may be changed, if the two secured parties agree to change the order of payment priority for each other. priority of payment is given priority to payment only within the scope of the guarantee of the party to whom it is subrogated.

Subsection 2

 Pledge of Property
Bộ luật dân sự@309:
Pledge of property

Pledge of property is when one party (hereinafter referred to as the pledgee) hands over the property under its ownership to another party (hereinafter referred to as the pledgee). ) to secure the performance of obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@310:
Effectiveness of mortgage of property

1. A property pledge contract takes effect from the time of its signing, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law.

2 The pledge of property takes effect against a third party from the time when the pledgee holds the pledged property.

In case the immovable property is the subject of the pledge in accordance with the law, the pledge The mortgage of immovable property takes effect against a third party from the time of registration.
Bộ luật dân sự@311:
Obligation of the pledgee

1. Deliver the pledged property to the pledgee in accordance with the agreement.

2. Bộ luật dân sự@335:
Guarantee

1. A guarantee is an undertaking by a third person (hereinafter referred to as the guarantor) to an obligee (hereinafter referred to as the guarantee) to perform an obligation on behalf of the obligee. to the obligor (hereinafter referred to as the guarantor), if the obligee fails to perform or performs improperly upon the due date of the obligation.

2. The parties may agreement on the fact that the guarantor is only required to perform the obligation on behalf of the guaranteed in case the obligee is unable to perform the guarantee obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@336:
Scope of guarantee

1. The guarantor may undertake to guarantee part or all of the obligation to the obligee.

2. The guarantee obligation includes interest. on principal, fines, compensation for damage, interest on late payment, unless otherwise agreed.

3. The parties may agree to use property security to secure guarantee performance of the guarantee obligation.

4. Where the guaranteed obligation is an obligation arising in the future, the scope of guarantee does not include the obligation arising after the death of the guarantor or the guarantor legal entity. will cease to exist.
Bộ luật dân sự@337:
Remuneration

The guarantor is entitled to remuneration if the guarantor and the guarantor agree.
Bộ luật dân sự@338:
Multiple guarantors

When more than one person guarantees the same obligation, they must jointly perform the guarantee, unless there is an agreement or the law provides for guarantee under independent parts. established; the obligee may require any of the joint guarantors to perform the entire obligation.

When one of the joint guarantors has performed the entire obligation on behalf of the joint guarantors. to the guarantor, has the right to require the remaining guarantors to perform their part of their obligations towards them.
Bộ luật dân sự@339:
Relationship between the guarantor and the guarantor

2. The guarantor may not require the guarantor to perform the obligation on behalf of the obligee when the obligation is not yet due.

3. The guarantor is not required to perform the guarantee obligation in the event the obligee may offset the obligation to the obligee.
Bộ luật dân sự@340:
The guarantor's right to demand

Bộ luật dân sự@341:
Exemption from the performance of guarantee obligations

2. In case only one of many joint guarantors is jointly exempted from performance. part of its guarantee obligations, others must still perform their guarantee obligations.

3. In case one of the guarantee recipients jointly exempts the guarantor from having to perform its part of the guarantee obligation. obligations towards themselves, the guarantor must still perform the remaining part of the obligations towards the remaining joint guarantors.
Bộ luật dân sự@342:
Civil liability of the guarantor
