Luật Điện ảnh@1:
Governing scope

This Law provides for cinematographic activities; rights, obligations and responsibilities of agencies, organizations and individuals participating in cinematographic activities; state management of cinematographic activities; film.
Luật Điện ảnh@2:
Applicable objects

1. Vietnamese agencies, organizations and individuals participating in cinematographic activities in Vietnam and abroad.

2. Foreign organizations and individuals participate in cinematographic activities in Vietnam.

3. State management agencies in charge of cinema; agencies, organizations and individuals involved in cinematographic activities.
Luật Điện ảnh@3:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Cinema is a general art industry, applying audio-visual technology and tricks. composed for film production.

2. Movie is a cinematographic work, whose content is expressed by continuous moving images or images created by technical and technological devices; whether or not has sound and other effects according to the principles of cinematic language; recorded on materials, digitally or other technical means and disseminated to viewers, including feature films of all kinds, documentaries, scientific films, cartoons and films of various genres.

Movies do not include video recordings for the purpose of disseminating news on radio, television and cyberspace services; art shows, video games; video productions of one or more people's activities, depicting actual events, situations or programs.

3. Cinematographic activities include film production, film distribution, film dissemination, promotion, cinematographic development promotion, depository, film storage, cinematic human resource training.

4. The film industry is a creative economy in the cultural sector, using artistic talent, cultural potential combined with technology and business skills to create cinematic works and cinematographic services. 

5. Cinematographic establishment means an enterprise, non-business unit or other organization established by an organization or individual, and performing cinematographic activities in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws.
 
6. Film production is the process of creating a movie from the development of the screenplay to the completion of the film.

7. Film distribution is the exchange, purchase, sale, rental, export or import of movies.

8. Film dissemination is the delivery of films to viewers through the forms of screening in cinemas, at public movie venues, at the headquarters of foreign diplomatic missions and cultural establishments established in Vietnam. , on television systems, cyberspace and other media.

9. Movie classification is the assessment of movie content, classifying movies for dissemination in accordance with the age of viewers or not allowed to be disseminated.

10. Screenplay is the entire film content expressed in writing or other characters on materials, by digital or other technical means.

11. Movie owner means an organization or individual that invests financially and in material and technical facilities to produce a film, buys movie ownership, or is gifted or inherits film ownership and in other forms as prescribed. of the law.

12. Vietnamese film means a film that has been allowed to be disseminated in Vietnam according to the provisions of this Law and has at least two of the following three elements: the director has Vietnamese nationality, has a Vietnamese cinema establishment engaged in film production , whose owner or co-owner is a Vietnamese organization or individual.

13. Provision of film production services is the provision of means, technical equipment, backgrounds, human resources and other activities related to film production.

14. The studio is a place to shoot scenes that meet the requirements of space, technical equipment to set the scene suitable for film production, including indoor and outdoor studios.

15 . Public cinema venues are theatres, cultural houses, exhibitors, cultural centers, clubs, accommodation service establishments, food service establishments, discos, shops. , shops, stadiums, sports halls, squares, public passenger transport means and other public means and places where film screenings are held.

Principles of cinematography

1. Building an advanced Vietnamese cinema imbued with national identity, meeting the people's demand for cultural enjoyment and international integration economy.

2. Preserve and promote traditional cultural values, ensure humanity, aesthetics and entertainment.

3. Respect and guarantee the right to creative freedom within the framework of the law, protect the intellectual property rights of organizations and individuals participating in cinematographic activities.

4. Ensure equality and fair competition of organizations and individuals participating in electronic activities. development of the film industry.

5. To develop the film industry in accordance with market rules and international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory.

6. Using effectively, openly, transparently, with focus and focus on state budget and social resources invested, supporting cinema, prioritizing highland, mountainous, border and island areas, ethnic minority areas and rural areas.

7. Comply with the provisions of law, social ethical standards, professional ethics and be responsible for building a healthy business culture.

Luật Trọng tài thương mại@1:
Governing scope

This Law provides for the competence of commercial arbitration, forms of arbitration, arbitration institutions, arbitrators; order and procedures for arbitration; rights, obligations and responsibilities of the parties in arbitration proceedings; jurisdiction of the Court over arbitration activities; organization and operation of foreign arbitrators in Vietnam and enforcement of arbitral awards.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@2:
Arbitration's jurisdiction to resolve disputes

1. Disputes between parties arising from commercial activities.

2. Disputes arising between parties in which at least one parties having commercial activities.

3. Other disputes between the parties as provided for by law shall be resolved by arbitration.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@3:
Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Commercial arbitration is a method of dispute settlement agreed by the parties and conducted by the parties. accordance with the provisions of this Law.

2. An arbitration agreement is an agreement between the parties on the settlement by arbitration of a dispute that may arise or has arisen.

3. The disputing parties means a Vietnamese or foreign individual, agency or organization participating in arbitration proceedings as a plaintiff or defendant.

4. Disputes involving foreign elements are disputes arising in commercial relations. Commercial and other legal relations involving foreign elements are specified in the Civil Code.

5. An arbitrator is a person selected by the parties or appointed by an arbitration center or a court for settlement. Disputes under this Law.

6. Regulatory arbitration is a form of dispute resolution at an arbitration center in accordance with this Law and its procedural rules.

7. Ad hoc arbitration is a form of dispute settlement in accordance with this Law and the order and procedures agreed upon by the parties.

8. Dispute settlement place is the place where the arbitration council conducts dispute settlement according to the agreement chosen by the parties or decided by the arbitration council if the parties do not agree. If the place of dispute settlement is conducted in the Vietnamese territory, the award must be deemed to have been made in Vietnam, regardless of where the arbitration council holds its meeting to issue such award.

9 . The arbitral award is the decision of the arbitral tribunal during the dispute settlement process.

10. An arbitral award is a decision of the arbitration council to settle the entire content of the dispute and to terminate the arbitration proceedings.

11. Foreign arbitration means an arbitrator established in accordance with the foreign arbitration law selected by agreement by the parties to settle disputes outside of Vietnam or within the territory of Vietnam.

12. A foreign arbitral award is an award declared by a foreign arbitrator outside the Vietnamese territory or within the Vietnamese territory to settle disputes as agreed upon by the parties.

4. Dispute settlement by Arbitration shall be conducted in a non-public manner, unless otherwise agreed by the parties.

5. Arbitration award is the final judge.

Explanation of terms

In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows:

1. Formal education is course-based education in an educational institution to carry out a certain educational programs, which are established according to the objectives of the educational levels, training levels and diplomas of the national education system.

2. Continuing education is education for implementation. a certain educational program, organized flexibly in terms of program implementation form, time, method, and location, meeting learners' lifelong learning needs.

3. Quality accreditation Education quality means the evaluation and recognition of an educational institution or training program meeting educational quality standards promulgated by a competent agency or organization.

4. Yearbook is a form of organization. organize the education and training process by school year.

5. Credit is a unit used to measure the amount of knowledge, skills and learning outcomes that have been accumulated in a certain period of time. 

6. A module is a learning unit that fully integrates knowledge, skills and attitudes to help learners have the ability to fully perform one or several jobs of a profession. .

7. The output standard is the requirement to meet the quality and capacity of learners after completing an educational program.

8. Universal education is the process of organizing educational activities so that all citizens of their age can study and reach a certain level of education as prescribed by law.

9. Compulsory education is the education that all citizens of the prescribed age are required to study in order to achieve the minimum educational level prescribed by law and which is guaranteed by the State to do so.
 
10. The mass of high school cultural knowledge is the basic and core knowledge and skills in the upper secondary education program that learners must accumulate in order to continue to study at a higher level of vocational education. .

11. Investor means an organization or individual that invests in education with capital sources outside the state budget, including domestic and foreign investors.

12. An educational institution is an organization carrying out educational activities in the national education system, including schools and other educational institutions.

Luật Giáo dục@109:
Recognition of foreign degrees

1. Diplomas issued by foreign educational institutions are recognized for use in Vietnam in the following cases:

a) Diplomas issued by foreign educational institutions General education institutions, overseas higher education institutions grant to learners after completing a quality education program according to the regulations of the granting country and approved by the competent educational agency of the foreign country. recognized by that institution;

b) Diplomas issued to learners by a foreign educational institution lawfully operating in another country where the educational institution's head office is located, and issued by the educational authority of the foreign educational institution. 02 countries allow the opening of branches or the implementation of training cooperation and association and satisfy the provisions of point a of this clause;

c) Diplomas granted by foreign educational institutions lawfully operating in Vietnam , carry out educational activities according to regulations on cooperation and investment in education promulgated by the Government, approved by competent authorities and satisfy the provisions of Point a of this Clause.

2. The Minister of Education and Training shall, within the ambit of his duties and powers, sign an international agreement on degree equivalence or mutual recognition of qualifications; detailing conditions, order, procedures and competence to recognize diplomas; provide information on quality-assured higher education institutions recognized by the host country.

The recognition of foreign-issued vocational education diplomas shall comply with the provisions of the Law on Vocational Education.
